Zohran Mamdani under fire over past ‘defund the NYPD’ remarks; shifts stance after visiting fallen NYC officer's family; old posts resurface online
Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani faces criticism for visiting the family of fallen NYPD officer Didarul Islam due to his past support for defunding the police. Critics accuse Mamdani of shifting his stance for political gain, especially after his 2020 tweets resurfaced. Mamdani defends his actions, clarifying his current position on public safety and police funding.
Zohran Mamdani under fire over past ‘defund the NYPD’ remarks; shifts stance after visiting fallen NYC officer's family; old posts resurface online - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIworldUSTimes EvokePakistanSouth AsiaUKEuropeChinaMiddle EastRest of WorldMad, Mad WorldPhotosVideosWeb StoriesToday's ePaperNewsResultsLife trailSocial PulsevideosPhotosExplainersIndians in USHumouroffbeatNewsWorld NewsUS NewsZohran Mamdani under fire over past ‘defund the NYPD’ remarks; shifts stance after visiting fallen NYC officer's family; old posts resurface onlineTrendingTsunami WarningDmitry MedvedevIce MummyVirginia mall scareMidtown Manhattan shootingDesmond WatsonSam AltmanTsunami WarningDmitry MedvedevIce MummyVirginia mall scareMidtown Manhattan shootingDesmond WatsonSam AltmanTsunami WarningDmitry MedvedevIce MummyVirginia mall scareMidtown Manhattan shootingDesmond WatsonSam AltmanZohran Mamdani under fire over past ‘defund the NYPD’ remarks; shifts stance after visiting fallen NYC officer's family; old posts resurface onlineTOI World Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Jul 31, 2025, 12:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeDemocratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani faces criticism for visiting the family of fallen NYPD officer Didarul Islam due to his past support for defunding the police. Critics accuse Mamdani of shifting his stance for political gain, especially after his 2020 tweets resurfaced. Mamdani defends his actions, clarifying his current position on public safety and police funding. Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani faces criticism for visiting the family of fallen NYPD officer Didarul Islam due to his past support for defunding the police. Critics accuse Mamdani of shifting his stance for political gain, especially after his 2020 tweets resurfaced. Mamdani defends his actions, clarifying his current position on public safety and police funding. Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani is facing backlash after visiting the family of fallen NYPD officer Didarul Islam, as critics pointed to his past 2020 tweet supporting "defund the police" stance.The controversy erupted after Mamdani, who recently returned from a trip to Uganda, visited the grieving family of officer Islam, one of four victims killed in a mass shooting in Midtown Manhattan. Zohran Mamdani’s SECRET Wedding Triggers Fury Amid Local Tragedy | WATCHThe shooter, Shane Tamura, opened fire on Monday, killing Islam and three others before shooting himself.Sharing a post on X, Mamdani wrote: “Two days ago, an act of senseless violence took the lives of Officer Didarul Islam, Wesley LePatner, Aland Etienne, and Julia Hyman. Today, I visited Officer Islam's family and learned of his legacy. I ask you to join me in honoring the memory of these four New Yorkers.”However, the post quickly drew criticism, with users referencing Mamdani’s previous tweets during the height of the “Defund the Police” movement in 2020.Many accused him of changing his stance for political gain. One user wrote, “You can't go from defund the police to never mind I love the police. You're asking New Yorkers to forgo their guns meanwhile you just had a wedding in Uganda with armed guards.”While another posted, “Zohran Mamdani exposed as a total fraud. Mocking cops, calling them racist, then acting like he cares? No loyalty to America. He belongs in Uganda, not leading NYC. Deport him and protect our city!”Earlier at a press conference following his visit to the officer’s home in The Bronx, Mamdani addressed the criticism and attempted to clarify his position saying: “I am not defunding the police; I am not running to defund the police.”“Over the course of this race, I’ve been very clear about my view of public safety and the critical role that the police have in creating that public safety,” he added.Standing alongside members of the Bangladeshi American Police Association—of which Officer Islam was a member—and labor union 32BJ, which represented another victim, Aland Etienne, Mamdani tried to strike a unifying tone.During the peak of the "Defund the Police" movement in 2020, Zohran Mamdani repeatedly called for major cuts to the NYPD budget. In one post, he wrote, “We don’t need an investigation to know that the NYPD is racist, anti-queer & a major threat to public safety. What we need is to #DefundTheNYPD.”In another, he said, “There is no negotiating with an institution this wicked & corrupt. Defund it. Dismantle it. End the cycle of violence,” referencing budget talks around proposed NYPD cuts.Now, Mamdani has distanced himself from those remarks. When asked about them, he responded, “My statements in 2020 were made amidst a frustration that many New Yorkers held at the murder of George Floyd.”Mamdani claimed that his current stance is more nuanced, stating that his previous posts were “clearly out of step” with his recent campaign platform. He now supports maintaining the NYPD headcount while reducing its overtime budget.Despite this clarification, skepticism remains. Many police officers and political observers have accused Mamdani of shifting positions purely for political gain in a city where public safety remains a top concern for voters, New York Post reported.Adding to the political firestorm, former Governor Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Eric Adams, who are both trailing Mamdani in early polling for the 2025 mayoral race, weighed in shortly after the shooting. Mamdani fired back, accusing Cuomo of politicising the tragedy saying, “It is beyond me that politicians are looking to use these days to score such cynical political points, on the very day that I held the father of Officer Islam in my arms and he could not utter a single word.”“For the former governor to spend an entire day speaking almost exclusively about me and barely about the New Yorkers who have been killed is indicative of the very politics New Yorkers want to leave in the past,” he added.All three, Mamdani, Cuomo, and Adams are expected to attend officer Islam’s funeral on Thursday.About the AuthorTOI World DeskAt TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Indian man rapes minor in Singapore: Ramalingam Selvasekaran molests 11-year-old wanting to buy ice-cream; gets over 14 years in jail
An Indian national, Ramalingam Selvasekaran, has been sentenced to over 14 years in a Singapore jail for sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl. The high court found him guilty of rape and outrage of modesty, following incidents at his Jurong West shop in 2021. Despite his denials and claims of erectile dysfunction, the judge deemed the victim's testimony credible.
Indian man rapes minor in Singapore: Ramalingam Selvasekaran molests 11-year-old wanting to buy ice-cream; gets over 14 years in jail - The Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOINRIUS & Canada NewsMiddle EastOther NewsNRI AchieversCitizen JournalistsVideosToday's ePaperNewsNRI NewsIndian man rapes minor in Singapore: Ramalingam Selvasekaran molests 11-year-old wanting to buy ice-cream; gets over 14 years in jailIndian man rapes minor in Singapore: Ramalingam Selvasekaran molests 11-year-old wanting to buy ice-cream; gets over 14 years in jailTOI World Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Jul 31, 2025, 08:39 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAn Indian national, Ramalingam Selvasekaran, has been sentenced to over 14 years in a Singapore jail for sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl. The high court found him guilty of rape and outrage of modesty, following incidents at his Jurong West shop in 2021. Despite his denials and claims of erectile dysfunction, the judge deemed the victim's testimony credible.  An Indian national was sentenced to more than 14 years in jail on Thursday by the Singapore high court for sexually assaulting a minor, reports the Straits Times.Ramalingam Selvasekaran was handed a sentence of 14 years, three months and two weeks after being found guilty of rape and two counts of outrage of modesty after assaulting an 11-year-old at his provision shop in Jurong West.According to the court, the assaults occurred between 4.50 pm and 5.05 pm on October 28, 2021. The girl had visited Ramalingam’s store and returned later to buy ice cream. Prosecutors said he led her into a back area and forced her to perform oral sex. After the incident, the girl sought help from a passerby, who called the police.Ramalingam represented himself during the trial, which began on January 16. He was convicted on all charges on 7 July.“The fact that she had not run off after the first act of molest, or that she did not resist the assaults, or inform her grandfather, were all to my mind sufficiently explained, particularly given that she was still young and immature,” said Justice Aidan Xu, who found the girl’s account credible and consistent.Ramalingam’s earlier statements to police reportedly included admissions of hugging, kissing, and oral sex. However, he later denied any wrongdoing, claiming he was suffering from erectile dysfunction and that no DNA evidence was found on the victim.The judge ruled that these claims did not undermine the girl’s testimony. “While there was no dispute that Ramalingam suffered from erectile dysfunction, the prosecution’s expert witness gave a cogent explanation that oral rape remained possible,” Justice Xu was quoted as saying to Straits Times.Following sentencing on July 30, Ramalingam said he would appeal and was granted bail of S$80,000. He attempted to negotiate with the judge over the conditions, asking for the removal of his electronic tag and exemption from reporting to the Police Cantonment Complex. Both requests were denied.About the AuthorTOI World DeskAt TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. India Asia Cup squad announcement Live: Selectors face tough call

India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Suryakumar Yadav arrives at venue; Press conference delayed due to adverse Mumbai weather  - The Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIcricketAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreICC RankingsWTC StandingsCricket ScheduleIND vs ENGIPL 2025Champions TrophyMLCToday's ePaperIndia Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Suryakumar Yadav arrives at venue; Press conference delayed due to adverse Mumbai weatherCommentaryNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIndia Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Suryakumar Yadav arrives at venue; Press conference delayed due to adverse Mumbai weatherLIVE NOWTHE TIMES OF INDIA | Aug 19, 2025, 12:54:31 ISTShareFollow us India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Suryakumar Yadav arrives at venue; Press conference delayed due to adverse Mumbai weatherIndia Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: As India’s selectors sit down on Tuesday to finalise the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup in the UAE, their biggest challenge could be fitting Shubman Gill into an already stable T20 set-up.   Gill, who has enjoyed a stellar run as Test captain in England, has struggled to slot seamlessly into the current T20 combination. For chief selector Ajit Agarkar and his panel, the question is whether it makes sense to disturb a side that has been functioning smoothly.   The talent pool available only complicates matters. Indian cricket currently has an abundance of options, with multiple players ready to step in for every position. At the top of the batting order alone, six names are in contention.   While Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Tilak Varma impressed last season, Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and IPL’s Orange Cap winner Sai Sudharsan are equally compelling picks.   In spin, the competition is just as tight. Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Ravi Bishnoi are all pressing for selection, while veteran Yuzvendra Chahal remains on the fringes.   Inside the team management, there are two schools of thought. Some feel it would be unjust to drop consistent performers in order to bring back a bigger star. Others argue that Gill represents the future of Indian cricket—an all-format captain in the making and a strong commercial face for the game.   But his return won’t be straightforward. Under Suryakumar Yadav’s captaincy, India has won 17 of its last 20 T20Is, a remarkable record achieved without Gill or Jaiswal. Yet, before focusing on Tests, both had been doing well in T20Is and the IPL.   Gill also briefly served as Surya’s deputy before his Test duties took over, with Axar Patel stepping in as vice-captain. Reinstating Gill could leave Axar feeling sidelined, despite his reliable performances.   If Gill is named in the 15, selectors may need to reshuffle the playing XI, forcing one of Abhishek, Sanju, or Tilak out. Rinku Singh could also miss out, particularly since head coach Gautam Gambhir doesn’t believe in a fixed “finisher’s” role, reducing the left-hander’s importance.   Fast Bowling Choices  Hardik Pandya, Jasprit Bumrah, and Arshdeep Singh are certainties, leaving one reserve seamer’s slot up for grabs. Harshit Rana appears to be the front-runner, with Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj largely seen as red-ball bowlers. With a home series against the West Indies in October, Bumrah may even be rested, giving others a chance.   Spin Department  Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, and Varun Chakravarthy are the leading names, with Washington Sundar likely to make the cut as well, thanks to his all-round abilities. Although conditions in Dubai and Abu Dhabi may not be overly slow, spinners are still expected to have a say.   All-rounders and Keepers  With Nitish Kumar Reddy and Rishabh Pant unavailable due to injuries, Shivam Dube is set to back up Hardik as a seam-bowling all-rounder. For the second wicketkeeper’s role, the contest is between Dhruv Jurel and Jitesh Sharma. Jitesh, who played a key role as a lower-order hitter in Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s IPL triumph, has the edge for the finisher’s slot. 12:54 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: ScheduleIndia will kick off their campaign against the UAE on September 10, while the high-voltage game against Pakistan is scheduled for the 14th, with both fixtures set to be played in Dubai. India will play their final group stage fixture against Oman on September 19 in Abu Dhabi.After the group stage, the tournament will proceed to the Super 4, where the top two teams from each group will qualify. If India finishes at the top of Group A, then all of their Super 4 matches will be held in Dubai. If India finishes second, then one of their Super 4 clashes will be held in Abu Dhabi and the remaining two in Dubai. The Super 4 stage will run from September 20 to 26. Dubai will host the final, which is scheduled for September 28.12:50 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Key talking pointsWith Suryakumar, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel being batting order certainties, it would be interesting to see if Shreyas gets a look in. What really strengthens Shreyas’ case is his spin-hitting prowess, much-improved skills to handle short balls and showing assurance as a reliable middle-order batter for Punjab Kings in IPL 2025.On the other hand, Jitesh’s name is a hot favourite for the reserve keeper-batter slot, who can also play finisher’s role when needed with his power-hitting skills and repertoire of ramps and scoops. Jitesh had a stellar IPL 2025 season with the bat and gloves to help Royal Challengers Bengaluru win its maiden IPL title.Amidst all this, Rinku, who was a part of India’s last T20I assignment against England in January, may just miss out. Rinku has been a designated finisher for both India and Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). But a patchy IPL season and what if India seeks an all-rounder to excel in slow conditions in Dubai and Abu Dhabi may conjure up to weaken Rinku’s case.With Nitish Kumar Reddy still undergoing rehab for knee ligament injury, Riyan, Sundar and Shivam Dube shape up as contenders for an all-rounders’ slot. Sundar’s off-spin along with his batting makes him a tempting prospect while Dube is a like-to-like replacement for Nitish in terms of skillsets.Riyan, whose batting and handy spin bowling got him on T20I tours of Zimbabwe and Sri Lanka in 2024, provides the balance, but has not done anything worthwhile yet. With Axar, Kuldeep Yadav, and Varun Chakaravarthy set to helm spin department, it would be interesting to see who between Sundar and Riyan gets selectors’ backing.In fast bowling department, with Hardik, Jasprit Bumrah (provided he’s picked) and Arshdeep Singh around, decision needs to be made on including either of Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna and Harshit Rana. In the end, the Asia Cup squad will be the first glimpse of India’s plans for the World Cup, and debate over inclusions and omissions is certain to continue until the main tournament gets underway.12:38 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Pakistan squadSalman Ali Agha (c), Abrar Ahmed, Faheem Ashraf, Fakhar Zaman, Haris Rauf, Hasan Ali, Hasan Nawaz, Hussain Talat, Khushdil Shah, Mohammad Haris (wk), Mohammad Nawaz, Mohammad Waseem Jnr, Sahibzada Farhan, Saim Ayub, Salman Mirza, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Sufyan Moqim.12:24 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Captain checked inTeam India captain Suryakumar Yadav has arrived at the BCCI HQ ahead of the team selection.11:58 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: Gill & JaiswalWhile Abhishek’s spot looks untouchable, the debate intensifies over the third opener. Click here to get all the updates.08:26 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Former selector opinesFormer India cricketer Chetan Sharma has predicted India's victory in the upcoming Asia Cup 2025, which will be held in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9 to 28. The tournament will follow the T20I format and feature eight teams competing across both venues, with Dubai hosting 11 matches and Abu Dhabi hosting eight fixtures."The players who will be selected will be the best for the country, and I am very proud of the way we are playing cricket, the way we played against England. We will win the Asia Cup," Sharma told reporters.The Asian Cricket Council has confirmed the participation of five full member nations - Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka - along with the UAE, Oman, and Hong Kong. The teams have been divided into two groups, with India, Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in Group A, while Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, and Hong Kong form Group B.08:06 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Top 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is whyThe 2025 T20 Asia Cup is set to have a very different look, with the leading run-getters of both India and Pakistan missing from the tournament.For India, stalwarts Rohit Sharma (4,231 runs) and Virat Kohli (4,188 runs) have already bid farewell to T20 internationals. On the other hand, Pakistan’s selectors have taken a bold step by leaving out Babar Azam (4,223 runs) and Mohammad Rizwan (3,414 runs) from the 17-member squad announced on Sunday.Pakistan, under new captain Salman Ali Agha, will warm up for the Asia Cup with a tri-series against Afghanistan and the UAE in Sharjah from August 29 to September 7. The continental showpiece kicks off in the Emirates on September 9.The exclusion of Babar and Rizwan has triggered intense debate across cricketing circles, especially considering the pair played pivotal roles in Pakistan’s iconic 10-wicket victory over India at the 2021 T20 World Cup.READ FULL STORY07:36 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: 'Don’t make Vaibhav Suryavanshi wait'Former India skipper Kris Srikkanth has backed 14-year-old sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi for a place in India’s 15-member squad for the Asia Cup T20, which begins on September 9. His endorsement comes just days before the selectors meet on August 19 to finalise the squad, with stiff competition for spots—particularly at the top of the order.Vaibhav has rapidly risen as a serious contender after a breakout season in IPL 2025, where he amassed 252 runs in just seven matches for the Rajasthan Royals at a strike rate of over 200. His whirlwind 35-ball century against Gujarat Titans was the second-fastest ton in IPL history, further cementing his reputation as one of the brightest young batting talents.The teenager carried that momentum into the U19 tour of England, where he struck a century and impressed across both one-day and four-day formats, showcasing his adaptability and temperament at the highest junior level."You have to play bold. Don't make him wait. Don't say things like 'let him mature'. He is already playing with remarkable maturity. His shot-making has been on another level. If I were chairman, I would definitely have him in the squad," Srikkanth stated on his YouTube show.READ FULL STORY07:06 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: All you need to know!When and where will 15-member side be announced? DateTimingVenue confirmedThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) will unveil its 15-member squad for the ACC Men’s Asia Cup 2025 on Tuesday, following a high-profile selection meeting in Mumbai. The Senior Men’s Selection Committee will gather at the BCCI headquarters, with the squad announcement scheduled for 1:30 PM (IST) on the 4th floor of the BCCI HQ.The press conference will be attended by India’s T20 captain and the chairman of selectors.The Asia Cup, to be played in the T20 format in the UAE from September 9 to 28, comes just a year after India lifted the 2024 T20 World Cup.Naturally, the spotlight is on continuity and trust in the young T20 specialists who powered India’s success.Suryakumar Yadav is expected to continue as captain, having cleared his fitness test at the BCCI’s Centre of Excellence.According to a report from TOI, star opener Shubman Gill, despite stellar Test and IPL performances, may find it difficult to break into the T20 side.With Sanju Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma delivering consistently in the shortest format, the management is keen to back them. TOI understands that Gill remains in the selectors’ long-term plans, but not as a frontline T20 option.On the bowling front, Jasprit Bumrah is set to return after overcoming a minor knee concern, while Mohammed Siraj could be rested following a heavy workload in England.Arshdeep Singh, Hardik Pandya, and Prasidh Krishna are likely seam-bowling options, with spinners Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Washington Sundar in contention for the UAE’s slow pitches.India are grouped with Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in the Asia Cup. They will open their campaign against UAE on September 10 in Dubai, before the much-anticipated clash against Pakistan on September 14.The women’s selection meeting will also take place later in the day, at 3:30 PM, to finalise India’s squad for the ODI series against Australia and the ICC Women’s World Cup.READ FULL STORY06:48 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Kuldeep Yadav + Varun Chakravarthy - India’s surprise Asia Cup weapon?The spin duo of Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy will be eagerly awaiting the selectors’ call as India’s squad for the Asia Cup 2025, scheduled from September 9, is set to be announced. Both would be keen to get their hands on leather and rattle the opposition.The two spinners come into the tournament with different recent history.Kuldeep spent the entire tour of England on the bench. Carrying drinks, passing on messages from the coaching staff, and quietly watching his teammates from the dressing room was all the chinaman managed over five Tests.Now, with the Asia Cup squad to be revealed on Tuesday (August 19), Kuldeep will be hoping to don the India blues, even if he didn't get the chance to wear the whites.The 30-year-old last featured in a T20I in the 2024 T20 World Cup, where he picked up 10 wickets in five matches. Overall, Kuldeep has played 40 T20Is, claiming 69 wickets, including two five-wicket hauls.Known for his deceptive wrong ’uns and sharp flippers, he remains a potent threat to batters, especially in UAE's spin-friendly conditions.While Kuldeep hasn’t played a T20I in the UAE, he has featured in ODIs there. He was also part of India’s victorious squads in the 2018 and 2023 editions of the Asia Cup (both in the ODI format).Varun Chakravarthy, meanwhile, has been in excellent form since making his international return last year.The 33-year-old mystery spinner, armed with nine different variations, has already produced match-winning spells, including two five-wicket hauls in T20Is and another in ODIs during India’s ICC Champions Trophy triumph.In his short T20I career so far, he has bagged 33 wickets in 18 matches.READ FULL STORY06:26 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: All-rounders and KeepersWith Nitish Kumar Reddy and Rishabh Pant still recovering from injuries, Shivam Dube is set to be the second seam-bowling all-rounder behind Pandya. The wicketkeeper debate is between Jitesh Sharma and Dhruv Jurel. Jitesh strengthened his case with impactful lower-order cameos during Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s title-winning IPL season, while Jurel has been a rising name in the mix.06:25 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Spin OptionsAmong spinners, Axar Patel, Varun Chakravarthy, and Kuldeep Yadav appear first-choice, with Washington Sundar likely to be included thanks to Gambhir’s preference for all-rounders. Conditions in Dubai and Abu Dhabi may not be as slow as in the Champions Trophy, but spin will still play a significant role.06:25 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Pacers’ PuzzleHardik Pandya doubles up as a frontline seamer alongside Jasprit Bumrah and Arshdeep Singh, leaving one spot for a reserve quick. Harshit Rana is currently the frontrunner, with Prasidh Krishna and Mohammed Siraj seen more as red-ball specialists. With a home series against West Indies looming in October, Bumrah could even be rested, allowing Prasidh and Siraj opportunities.06:24 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: 'Sweet' headache for selectorsAs India’s selectors sit down on Tuesday to finalise the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup in the UAE, their biggest challenge could be fitting Shubman Gill into an already stable T20 set-up.Gill, who has enjoyed a stellar run as Test captain in England, has struggled to slot seamlessly into the current T20 combination. Rinku Singh could also miss out, particularly since head coach Gautam Gambhir doesn’t believe in a fixed “finisher’s” role, reducing the left-hander’s importance.06:23 (IST) Aug 19India Asia Cup Squad Announcement Live: Hello and welcome!Hello and welcome to the Live coverage of the India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update.The biggest challenge before India’s selection committee on Tuesday will be finding a way to accommodate Shubman Gill in a well-settled T20 side for next month’s Asia Cup in the UAE.Gill, fresh from a dream run as Test captain in England, has not quite found a natural place in the current T20 set-up that will compete in the continental event from September 9 to 28. For chairman Ajit Agarkar and his colleagues, the dilemma is whether to tinker with a winning combination that hardly needs fixing.India’s problem of plenty makes the decision even harder. With at least 30 players ready to step in and multiple contenders for every role, the selectors have the luxury—and the headache—of choice. For the top three batting slots alone, six players are in contention.Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Tilak Varma impressed last season in India colours, while Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and IPL Orange Cap winner Sai Sudharsan are equally strong options.The bowling unit has its own battles. Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Ravi Bishnoi are vying for one place, while the experienced Yuzvendra Chahal continues to be overlooked.Within team management, opinions differ. One faction believes it would be unfair to drop a regular performer just to make room for a bigger name. The other sees Gill as the future face of Indian cricket, an all-format captain and a marketable brand who should naturally slot in.But transition won’t be simple. Under Suryakumar Yadav’s leadership, India has won 17 of its last 20 T20Is—a remarkable 85% success rate—without Gill or Jaiswal in the mix. Both, however, had previously performed well in T20Is and the IPL before Test commitments kept them away.Gill even served as vice-captain to Suryakumar before stepping aside, with Axar Patel stepping in as deputy. If Gill returns, Axar could justifiably feel hard done by, despite his solid leadership stint.If Gill is included in the 15, the selectors will face the tougher call of slotting him into the playing XI. That would likely push out one of Sanju, Abhishek, or Tilak. Another possible casualty is Rinku Singh, whose finishing role has diminished under head coach Gautam Gambhir, who does not believe in the idea of a “designated finisher.”India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: The biggest challenge before India’s selection committee on Tuesday will be finding a way to accommodate Shubman Gill in a well-settled T20 side for next month’s Asia Cup in the UAE.

Gill, fresh from a dream run as Test captain in England, has not quite found a natural place in the current T20 set-up that will compete in the continental event from September 9 to 28. For chairman Ajit Agarkar and his colleagues, the dilemma is whether to tinker with a winning combination that hardly needs fixing.

India’s problem of plenty makes the decision even harder. With at least 30 players ready to step in and multiple contenders for every role, the selectors have the luxury—and the headache—of choice. For the top three batting slots alone, six players are in contention.

Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Tilak Varma impressed last season in India colours, while Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and IPL Orange Cap winner Sai Sudharsan are equally strong options.

The bowling unit has its own battles. Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Ravi Bishnoi are vying for one place, while the experienced Yuzvendra Chahal continues to be overlooked.

Within team management, opinions differ. One faction believes it would be unfair to drop a regular performer just to make room for a bigger name. The other sees Gill as the future face of Indian cricket, an all-format captain and a marketable brand who should naturally slot in.

But transition won’t be simple. Under Suryakumar Yadav’s leadership, India has won 17 of its last 20 T20Is—a remarkable 85% success rate—without Gill or Jaiswal in the mix. Both, however, had previously performed well in T20Is and the IPL before Test commitments kept them away.

Gill even served as vice-captain to Suryakumar before stepping aside, with Axar Patel stepping in as deputy. If Gill returns, Axar could justifiably feel hard done by, despite his solid leadership stint.

If Gill is included in the 15, the selectors will face the tougher call of slotting him into the playing XI. That would likely push out one of Sanju, Abhishek, or Tilak. Another possible casualty is Rinku Singh, whose finishing role has diminished under head coach Gautam Gambhir, who does not believe in the idea of a “designated finisher.”TrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spotlight on Shafali Verma

Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced today  - The Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIcricketAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreICC RankingsWTC StandingsCricket ScheduleIND vs ENGIPL 2025Champions TrophyMLCToday's ePaperWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayCommentaryNewsSports NewsCricket NewsWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayLIVE NOWTHE TIMES OF INDIA | Aug 19, 2025, 12:29:53 ISTShareFollow us Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: India's women's cricket selection panel, led by Neetu David, will convene in Mumbai on Tuesday to pick the ODI World Cup squad, with key decisions pending on including Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur. The tournament, featuring eight teams, will begin September 30 with India hosting all matches except Pakistan's games, which will be played in Colombo.   India enters the World Cup with strong momentum after defeating England in white-ball series and winning the ODI tri-series involving Sri Lanka and South Africa in April. The team will also host Australia for three ODIs as part of their preparation.   The selectors face a crucial decision regarding Shafali Verma's inclusion in the batting lineup. Since her return against England, she has shown mixed form with scores of 3, 47, 31, and 75, followed by underwhelming performances against Australia A scoring 3, 3, and 41.   The current batting order appears settled with Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal opening, supported by Jemimah Rodrigues, Harleen Deol, and captain Harmanpreet Kaur in the middle order.   Renuka Thakur's fitness assessment will be another key consideration. The premier seam bowler has been sidelined since March, and her recovery status will be evaluated considering the upcoming World Cup's workload demands.   Richa Ghosh is set to be the primary wicketkeeper, with Yastika Bhatia, who recently scored two fifties against Australia A in Brisbane, as a potential backup. 12:29 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Tournament Details OutThe ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 will run from September 30 to November 2. Hosts India will kick off their campaign against Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru, with matches to be spread across multiple venues.12:13 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Update from Mumbai&mdash; toi_gauravG (@toi_gauravG) 12:05 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Road to Redemption After 2017 HeartbreakIndia will look to go one better than in 2017, when they lost a nail-biting final to England at Lord’s. Harmanpreet & Co. now aim to finally bring home the Women’s World Cup trophy, riding on the momentum of the WPL and recent series wins.11:52 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: India’s World Cup HistoryThe 2025 edition will be the first senior ICC Women’s event in the sub-continent since 2016. India has hosted the Women’s World Cup thrice before — in 1978, 1997 and 2013. The tournament returns to familiar soil at a time when women’s cricket in India is booming like never before.11:41 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Update&mdash; AraniBasuTOI (@AraniBasuTOI) 11:36 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: ICC CEO on Women’s Cricket & India’s ProgressAt the '50 Days to Go' event recently, the ICC CEO Sanjog Gupta said the rise of women’s cricket mirrors India’s progress. “World Cups are more than events; they are apertures for building legacies and cultures. This World Cup can be the springboard for the game’s next leap,” he stressed.11:31 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Countdown beginsThe Women’s World Cup kicks off on September 30 in Bengaluru, with India facing Sri Lanka in the opening match at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. With the WPL pipeline strengthening India’s squad depth and players like Smriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues leading the charge, the hosts are aiming to finally lift the trophy after coming agonisingly close in 2017.11:15 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: UPDATEKindly note that the first press conference is expected to be delayed owing to weather disruptions.11:00 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live:  A Memory of 2017Jemimah recalled her own early days as a fan, when she went to the airport in 2017 to welcome back the Indian team after their heartbreaking final defeat. “At 5:30 am the whole airport was packed with fans. Back then, for women’s cricket, that wasn’t normal. The players were shocked to see so many people,” she said, calling it a turning point for the women’s game in India.10:46 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Jemimah on WPL EffectWith 50 days to go for the ICC Women’s World Cup 2025, Jemimah Rodrigues credited the Women’s Premier League for giving young players the confidence to excel on the international stage. She highlighted pacer Kranti Gaud’s fearless bowling in England, where the 22-year-old emerged as the leading wicket-taker with nine scalps, including a stunning six-for.10:39 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live:  Focus on Present, Not MilestonesFresh from series wins in England (2-1 T20Is, 3-2 ODIs), Mandhana stressed that the team is concentrating only on preparations. “Whenever we’ve done well, everything else has taken care of itself. We’ve had a camp, the England tour, and one more before the World Cup — that’s our focus,” she noted.10:21 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Lessons from 2017 World CupMandhana recalled India’s memorable 2017 campaign, where she scored 232 runs, including a century vs West Indies. “We all remember that World Cup… Harmanpreet’s 171, everyone’s contribution. The welcome from fans afterwards changed everything for women’s cricket in India,” she said, reliving the turning point.10:11 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Mandhana on India’s New MindsetWith 50 days left for the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025, opener Smriti Mandhana says India’s calm and focused mindset is their biggest strength. “The mindset has changed… there’s a calmness with which I want to go about the field. We know where to work hard and how to implement,” she told ICC.09:45 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Confidence from recent winsWith India set to open their campaign against Sri Lanka on September 30 in Bengaluru, Harmanpreet believes the team carries strong momentum. “The confidence is very high. The kind of cricket we have played over the last couple of years, especially in England, gives us a lot of belief,” the skipper said recently.Don't missanything!Subscribe to our newsletter and get all the stories that matter delivered to your inboxInvalid id. Please enter againBy subscribing to newsletter, you acknowledge our privacy policy09:22 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Reliving the 171 Knock*Harmanpreet reflected on her unforgettable 171* against Australia in the 2017 semi-final, calling it a turning point for women’s cricket in India. “That knock was special for me and for women’s cricket. At the time I didn’t realise its impact, but when we came back, the support we received was overwhelming,” she said.09:18 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Harmanpreet’s world cup missionIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur says her approach to the upcoming ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup will be “the same as my first ODI World Cup” — to enjoy her game while giving 100%. Leading in her maiden World Cup as skipper, Kaur is determined to “break that final barrier” and deliver India’s first senior ICC trophy.09:02 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Winning at home would be hugeMithali stressed that clinching the Cup in India would be a landmark moment for women’s cricket in the country. “We’ve come close twice, but never lifted it. Winning at home would be special, not just for players but for every fan,” she told ICC Digital, highlighting how the victory could inspire future generations.08:54 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Mithali Raj’s Big MessageFormer India skipper Mithali Raj has underlined the importance of “seizing crucial moments” if India are to lift their maiden Women’s ODI World Cup on home soil. Raj, who led India to finals in 2005 and 2017, believes momentum-shifting passages decide big games and could separate champions from contenders.08:45 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Men's Asia Cup selection squadToday squad for the men's Asia Cup is also be announced. You can check all the live updates here.  Stay tuned!08:42 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Rising stars push for inclusionKranti Goud’s six-wicket haul against England and Yastika Bhatia’s twin fifties for India A have strengthened their cases. Add to that the fitness cloud over all-rounder Amanjot Kaur, and the selectors face a tricky puzzle to maintain depth and balance in Harmanpreet Kaur’s side.08:42 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spin options aboundWith the World Cup in the subcontinent, spinners will be in high demand. Deepti Sharma, Sneh Rana and Radha Yadav remain the frontline options, while youngster N Shree Charani impressed in T20Is against England. The selectors must balance experience with youth in India’s spin-heavy arsenal.08:41 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Renuka Thakur’s Fitness TestThe status of pacer Renuka Thakur is a major concern. Out since March with injury, the right-arm quick could prove crucial with the new ball in Indian conditions. The upcoming ODI series against Australia may act as her comeback stage, provided she clears fitness and workload assessments.08:40 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spotlight on Shafali VermaShafali Verma’s inclusion remains the talking point. Since her return against England, she scored 3, 47, 31 and 75, but faltered in the Australia A series with twin failures (3, 3, 41). Will the selectors risk disrupting the stable opening pair of Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal to inject Shafali’s firepower?08:40 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Selection Meeting UnderwayThe women’s selection panel, headed by Neetu David, is meeting today to finalise India’s squad for the ODI World Cup starting September 30. With recent wins over England and South Africa boosting confidence, all eyes are on whether Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur make the cut.08:38 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: WelcomeHello and welcome to our live coverage of the Women's World Cup squad announcement. The women’s selection panel, headed by Neetu David, will face some tricky questions on the inclusion of Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur when it meets here on Tuesday to pick the squad for the ODI World Cup.We'll be bringing you all the live updates. Stay tuned. Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: The selection committee led by Neetu David is set to announce India's Women's ODI World Cup squad and the team for the three-match home ODI series against Australia on Tuesday afternoon. The same squad is likely to be chosen for both events, with only minimal changes possible based on the decisions of the five-member selection committee and team management.

The selection committee is also expected to pick an India A team for the World Cup warm-up game against South Africa at the BCCI Centre of Excellence Ground in Bengaluru.

The first two women's ODIs between India and Australia will be held at the Mullanpur stadium on September 14 and 17, followed by the final match at New Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium on September 20.

Mullanpur will host women's international cricket for the first time, while New Delhi will stage a women's ODI after nearly 28 years.

The Indian team, under Harmanpreet Kaur's leadership, enters its final World Cup preparation phase after successful ODI tri-series victory in Sri Lanka and white-ball series wins in England.

Smriti Mandhana, Harmanpreet Kaur, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Richa Ghosh are confirmed for the batting lineup. Pratika Rawal, who has scored 703 runs since her debut last year, and Harleen Deol are likely to continue, with Yastika Bhatia as second wicketkeeper.

Shafali Verma's selection remains uncertain due to inconsistent performance. Despite head coach Amol Muzumdar indicating her consideration for World Cup selection, her recent scores in Australia have been modest.

Amanjot Kaur, who replaced the injured Pooja Vastrakar, faces careful workload management due to a back injury from the England ODI series. While cleared to play, she might be reserved for crucial World Cup matches.TrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI AUS vs SA Live Score, 1st ODI: Latest updates from Australia against South Africa in Cairns

South Africa 230/4 in 40.3 Overs | AUS vs SA Live Score, 1st ODI: Latest updates from Australia against South Africa in Cairns  - The Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIcricketAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreICC RankingsWTC StandingsCricket ScheduleIND vs ENGIPL 2025Champions TrophyMLCToday's ePaperAUS vs SA Live Score, 1st ODI: Latest updates from Australia against South Africa in CairnsCommentaryScorecardNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAUS vs SA Live Score, 1st ODI: Latest updates from Australia against South Africa in CairnsLIVE NOWTHE TIMES OF INDIA | Aug 19, 2025, 12:53:29 ISTShareFollow us AUS vs SA Live Score, 1st ODI: Latest updates from Australia against South Africa in CairnsAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, 1st ODI: Australia's stand-in ODI captain Mitchell Marsh has indicated the team will maintain their aggressive batting approach as they transition from T20Is to ODIs against South Africa, with the first match scheduled for Tuesday at Cazalys Stadium. Marsh, who led Australia to a 2-1 victory in the T20I series, will continue his captaincy role as regular captain Pat Cummins takes a rest.   The Australian team successfully implemented an attacking strategy from the start in the T20I series, though it occasionally resulted in batting collapses.   "Getting ready to spend three and a half hours in the field will be a little bit different for a few of the boys. But as a group and as a whole, nothing really changes. (There's a) bit of a mindset change, it's obviously different format. But the same stuff rolls on," Marsh told reporters on Monday.   Marsh has experience leading Australia in ODIs, having captained nine times previously, including tours to South Africa in 2023 and England in 2024 when Cummins was unavailable.   The Australian captain suggested they might continue their preference for chasing targets in the ODI series, similar to their T20I approach.   "It's a bit of a common trend, generally speaking, in T20 cricket these days. You get to assess the conditions, but you also just know what you're chasing. I'm certainly not afraid to bat first. But we have lent towards bowling first. Playing with dew is not something that we're used to in Australia. We saw the ball get really soft in Darwin. That's been a different challenge for us," he elaborated.   The ODI series will continue with the second and third matches scheduled at the Great Barrier Reef Arena in Mackay on Friday and Sunday. Australia have shown good discipline with the ball as spin has been effective, and a few chances here and there have been created. However, the Aussies haven't been able to string wickets in clusters, which has allowed the Proteas to string partnerships. With 8 wickets in hand and a couple of proper hitters yet to come, the tourists seem to be off to a big total on a slow pitch. Currently, this stand between Matthew Breetzke and skipper Temba Bavuma has stitched together 53 runs, and Australia are in search of a breakthrough. A couple of quick wickets moving towards the climax of the innings could prove handy. But they need them now. A change in bowling as Aaron Hardie returns for another spell. He is 1-0-13-0 so far. Also, as per the new ICC rules, it seems like Australia have picked one ball of the two to continue till the end of the innings. 12:19 (IST) Aug 19Score after 34 overs 184 - 2Runs Scored: 0 004001Matthew Breetzke 36 (36)Temba Bavuma 31 (44)Nathan Ellis5-0-27-01Overs33.6Score184 - 2 Nathan Ellis to Matthew Breetzke, Length ball, angled into off and middle, Breetzke is late on the shot but jams his bat down in time and gets it in front of point for a single.12:19 (IST) Aug 190Overs33.5Score183 - 2 Nathan Ellis to Matthew Breetzke, This one stays low! Lands it full and outside off, Matthew Breetzke looks to work that off side but gets beaten by the change of pace.223 More UpdatesSee More UpdatesAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, 1st ODI: South African cricket sensation Dewald Brevis is set to make his ODI debut against Australia in the opening game at Cairns' Cazaly's Stadium on Tuesday. Following his impressive performance in the T20I series, Brevis' entry marks South Africa's preparation for the 2027 ODI World Cup, which they will co-host with Zimbabwe and Namibia.

Temba Bavuma, fresh from lifting the World Test Championship mace at Lord's, will lead the South African side. The team sees the return of Keshav Maharaj in the spin department, while Bavuma has confirmed his position at No. 3 in the batting order.

Wiaan Mulder seeks to build on his bowling success from the Champions Trophy as he aims to cement his place in the 50-over format.

The Australian team faces lineup changes due to injuries to Matt Short, Mitchell Owen, and Lance Morris. This has created opportunities for newcomers Cooper Connolly, Aaron Hardie, and Matt Kuhnemann.

Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc will not participate in the series. Marnus Labuschagne returns to the squad, looking to revive his international career after being dropped from the Test side earlier this year.

Mitchell Marsh will captain the Australian side. He has indicated a preference for bowling first after winning the toss, though dew conditions in Cairns may affect this decision.

The venue's history suggests challenging batting conditions. Previous ODIs between Australia and New Zealand in 2022 saw totals rarely exceeding 267, favoring the bowling sides.

Cameron Green, who scored his highest ODI score of 89 not out at this ground, is expected to play a key role, potentially batting at No. 3.

With three matches scheduled over five days, Australia plans to rotate their fast bowlers, giving South Africa varying bowling combinations to face.

Brevis, known for his aggressive batting style and ability to hit boundaries, represents South Africa's future in ODI cricket as they begin their journey toward the 2027 World Cup.

The series presents an opportunity for both teams to test new talent while maintaining competitive standards in this established cricket rivalry.TrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar Revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Surya's catch
Ambati Rayudu has revealed that the boundary rope in the T20 World Cup final between India and South Africa was unintentionally moved back due to broadcast equipment. This adjustment, according to Rayudu, played a crucial role in Suryakumar Yadav's catch to dismiss David Miller. Despite the controversy, Rayudu maintains the catch was legitimate, attributing India's triumph to divine intervention.
Big revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsBig revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCHTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinBig revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAmbati Rayudu has revealed that the boundary rope in the T20 World Cup final between India and South Africa was unintentionally moved back due to broadcast equipment. This adjustment, according to Rayudu, played a crucial role in Suryakumar Yadav's catch to dismiss David Miller. Despite the controversy, Rayudu maintains the catch was legitimate, attributing India's triumph to divine intervention. Suryakumar Yadav NEW DELHI: Former Indian cricketer Ambati Rayudu has shed new light on one of the most debated moments from the T20 World Cup 2024 final between India and South Africa — Suryakumar Yadav’s boundary catch to dismiss David Miller. According to Rayudu, the catch became possible because the boundary rope had been unintentionally pushed back earlier in the day when broadcast equipment was placed near the rope.Rayudu’s revelation comes more than a year after India’s title-winning final against South Africa, where Suryakumar’s stunning effort at the boundary was remembered as one of the defining moments.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'The dismissal, which turned out to be a defining moment in India’s triumph, drew scrutiny when replays showed the rope appeared to be positioned differently than usual.Speaking on the Unfiltered Podcast, Rayudu, who was part of the commentary team during the final, explained: "There were world feed commentators. During the break, what usually happens is they put a chair there and a screen in order to help the broadcasters see what is happening. That is why they pushed the rope backwards a little bit. But, they left it like that (even after taking the screen and the chair away). That is how the boundary became a little bigger for us. We (the commentators) could see it from above. It was god's plan."When asked whether the shot would have cleared the boundary under normal circumstances, Rayudu replied:PollDo you agree with Rayudu's statement that 'God was with us'?Yes, it's a matter of fateNo, skill was the deciding factorI think it's a mix of bothI don't believe in fate"I don't know if it was a six (in natural circumstances) or not. If the rope had been placed at its normal position, maybe Surya would've run from inside."Despite the controversy, Rayudu insisted the dismissal was legitimate. "End of the day, God was with us," he said, adding that it was a “clean catch.”The rope placement sparked reactions from several current and former cricketers at the time, though the debate eventually faded. Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

India squad: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as opener
The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup, with Abhishek Sharma's selection a near certainty. His explosive IPL seasons and international success, including topping the ICC T20I batting rankings, make him indispensable. Sharma's formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson and consistent performances solidify his place as India's T20I spearhead.
India squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as opener | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIndia squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as openerTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaIndia squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as openerHijam Raju Singh / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 10:56 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup, with Abhishek Sharma's selection a near certainty. His explosive IPL seasons and international success, including topping the ICC T20I batting rankings, make him indispensable. Sharma's formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson and consistent performances solidify his place as India's T20I spearhead. Abhishek Sharma has staked his claim at the top of the order in India's T20 team.  The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will convene at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Tuesday to pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup. The tournament, scheduled in the UAE from September 9–28, will be played in the T20I format, making it an important stepping stone towards the T20 World Cup next year.LIVE: Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIndia, placed in Group A alongside Pakistan, UAE, and Oman, will be watched closely as the selectors look to strike the balance between experience and youth. One name, however, should not even be up for debate — Abhishek Sharma.EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'From IPL sensation to India’s T20I spearheadAbhishek Sharma’s case for selection writes itself. His rise has been meteoric since his breakthrough IPL 2024 season for Sunrisers Hyderabad, where he hammered 484 runs at a staggering strike rate of 204.21.And if anyone thought 2024 was a one-off, Abhishek proved them wrong with another breathtaking IPL in 2025: 439 runs, which included a highest score of 141, at another stunning strike rate of 193.39. PollDo you believe the selectors should prioritize experience over youth in the squad selection?Yes, experience is crucialNo, youth brings energyThat form translated to the international stage almost instantly. After an anticlimactic four-ball duck on debut against Zimbabwe in July 2024, he responded with a jaw-dropping 100 off 47 balls in the very next match. Since then, the 24-year-old left-hander has not looked back, cementing his place at the top of India’s T20I order.Fast forward a year, and Abhishek sits at the very top of the ICC T20I batting rankings, making him the youngest Indian ever to achieve the No. 1 status in the format. He currently leads the chart ahead of compatriots Tilak Varma (No.2) and Suryakumar Yadav (No.6). That alone is a telling indicator of his indispensability.The numbers don’t lieIndia batter Abhishek Sharma. In 16 T20I innings for India, Abhishek has amassed 535 runs at a blistering strike rate of 193.85 — the highest for any Indian with over 500 runs in the format. His record already features two centuries and two fifties, underlining his ability to provide explosive starts and play match-winning knocks.His most recent masterpiece came against England at the Wankhede Stadium, where he smashed a record-breaking 135 off 54 balls — the highest individual T20I score by an Indian. That innings included 13 sixes and showcased his unmatched ability to dismantle world-class bowling.Crucially, Abhishek has formed a formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson. Since being paired together against Bangladesh in October 2024, the duo have opened in 12 consecutive matches, giving India explosive starts almost every time.Abhishek Sharma in last 12 T20Is: 411 runs @34.25, SR 200.49 (2 fifties, 1 hundred)Sanju Samson in last 12 T20Is: 417 runs @37.91, SR 183.70 (3 hundreds)India’s record with Abhishek-Samson opening: 10 wins in 12 matchesThese numbers reflect not just individual brilliance but also a stable, high-impact opening formula that has worked wonders for India. The competition: Shubman Gill and Yashasvi JaiswalAbhishek Sharma, Shubman Gill and Yashasvi JaiswalThe selection dilemma lies in who joins Abhishek and Samson as the third opener. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, both coming off a prolific Test series in England, will stake their claims. But their T20I credentials have faded in comparison.Jaiswal’s last T20I: July 2024 vs Sri Lanka (10 off 9).Gill’s last T20I: Same match, scoring 39 off 37.Neither has played a T20I in more than a year, while Abhishek has established himself as India’s most consistent powerplay batter. Given the contrasting trajectories, the selectors may consider carrying either Gill or Jaiswal as backup, but dislodging Abhishek is not an option.Why Abhishek Sharma is non-negotiableWorld No.1 T20I batter – His ranking is a reflection of dominance across opponents and conditions.Explosive strike rate – At nearly 194 in internationals and 193.39 in IPL 2025, his scoring rate dwarfs not just Indian contemporaries but also most global stars.Big-match temperament – Two T20I hundreds already, including a record knock against England, underline his ability to step up.Proven opening partnership – The Abhishek-Samson duo has become India’s most reliable T20I opening combo in recent years.Consistency – Back-to-back stellar IPL seasons, apart from international success, have made him the most bankable young T20 batter in India.As India gear up for the Asia Cup, much chatter will swirl around Shubman Gill’s return, Yashasvi Jaiswal’s case, or middle-order reshuffles. But in the opening slot, there is no ambiguity. Abhishek Sharma has evolved from a promising IPL star into India’s T20I batting spearhead, with numbers, form, and rankings all backing his claim.The selectors may face tough calls in other departments, but when it comes to Abhishek, the decision is straightforward. He is not just a part of India’s Asia Cup squad — he is the foundation on which their T20 future must be built.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Why Kuldeep and Varun could make for a lethal combo in Asia Cup
Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement, hoping to showcase their spin prowess. Kuldeep, after a stint on the sidelines in England, aims to reignite his T20I form, while Varun looks to continue his impressive international return. Their coach believes their partnership could be a formidable weapon for India in the tournament.
Why an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia Cup | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsWhy an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia CupTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinWhy an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia CupAmit Kumar / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 08:28 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement, hoping to showcase their spin prowess. Kuldeep, after a stint on the sidelines in England, aims to reignite his T20I form, while Varun looks to continue his impressive international return. Their coach believes their partnership could be a formidable weapon for India in the tournament. Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy  NEW DELHI: The spin duo of Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy will be eagerly awaiting the selectors’ call as India’s squad for the Asia Cup 2025, scheduled from September 9, is set to be announced. Both would be keen to get their hands on leather and rattle the opposition.The two spinners come into the tournament with different recent history.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'Kuldeep spent the entire tour of England on the bench. Carrying drinks, passing on messages from the coaching staff, and quietly watching his teammates from the dressing room was all the chinaman managed over five Tests.Now, with the Asia Cup squad to be revealed on Tuesday (August 19), Kuldeep will be hoping to don the India blues, even if he didn't get the chance to wear the whites.The 30-year-old last featured in a T20I in the 2024 T20 World Cup, where he picked up 10 wickets in five matches. Overall, Kuldeep has played 40 T20Is, claiming 69 wickets, including two five-wicket hauls.Known for his deceptive wrong ’uns and sharp flippers, he remains a potent threat to batters, especially in UAE's spin-friendly conditions.While Kuldeep hasn’t played a T20I in the UAE, he has featured in ODIs there. He was also part of India’s victorious squads in the 2018 and 2023 editions of the Asia Cup (both in the ODI format).PollWhat is the key factor for India to succeed in the Asia Cup 2025?Strong batting lineupBowling partnershipsFielding and fitnessTeam strategy and preparationVarun Chakravarthy, meanwhile, has been in excellent form since making his international return last year.The 33-year-old mystery spinner, armed with nine different variations, has already produced match-winning spells, including two five-wicket hauls in T20Is and another in ODIs during India’s ICC Champions Trophy triumph.In his short T20I career so far, he has bagged 33 wickets in 18 matches.PlayerMatchesWktsBBIBBMAveEconSR4w5wKuldeep Yadav40695/175/1714.076.7712.412Varun Chakravarthy18335/175/1714.577.0212.402Kuldeep’s coach Kapil Pandey believes both bowlers are primed to shine at the Asia Cup and could form a dangerous partnership with Varun."Every cricketer feels upset if he doesn’t get a chance. Kuldeep was sad too. But I told him — whatever has gone is gone, it’s time to look forward. He is really looking forward to a chance in the Asia Cup. He is hungry for wickets. India will benefit hugely from Kuldeep. And if he forms a combo with Varun, then the opposition will have a tough time. Varun is a solid bowler. They both complement each other when on the field," Kapil told TimesofIndia.com."Opposition teams were scared of Kuldeep, and now they are scared of Varun too. If India play Pakistan, it will be a night to remember. These two guys will completely outfox them. They will not give them time to think. Kuldeep is very hungry right now," the coach added.India have been placed in Group A alongside Oman, hosts UAE, and arch-rivals Pakistan. Group B consists of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Hong Kong, and Sri Lanka.With the Asia Cup followed by the 2026 T20 World Cup, the tournament provides both Kuldeep and Varun with the perfect opportunity to stake their claim for long-term spots in India’s T20I setup.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch: Virat Kohli continues to toil in the nets as India return nears
Virat Kohli, following his emotional IPL victory with Royal Challengers Bengaluru in 2025, is set to return to cricket during India's Australia tour in October. Spotted training in London, Kohli's dedication remains strong. Speculation surrounds his future, with potential retirement looming after the Australia series.

Spotted training in London, Kohli's dedication remains strong. Speculation surrounds his future, with potential retirement looming after the Australia series. Virat Kohli with a fan during a nets session in London. (Image: X) Former India captain Virat Kohli, who has retired from Tests and T20Is, is expected to return to competitive cricket in October during India's white-ball tour of Australia. The 36-year-old batting star was last seen getting emotional after leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their first IPL title in 2025, and has since been in London where he continues to train and practice.A recent viral social media image suggested Kohli was busy during a practice session in London, indicating his continued engagement with cricket despite his partial retirement. The photograph captured him posing with a fan during his training stint.EXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh on Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Shubman Gill, India vs Pakistan and moreEarlier in August, Kohli shared an Instagram Story featuring himself with Gujarat Titans' assistant coach Naeem Ali at a training facility. He wrote: "Thanks for helping out with the hit brother. Always lovely to see you."The cricket legend's future plans have become a subject of speculation, with reports citing BCCI sources suggesting both Kohli and Rohit Sharma might retire after the upcoming Australia series.It has been claimed that if Kohli and Rohit aim to participate in the 2027 ODI World Cup in Africa, they will need to compete in the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy, India's premier domestic one-day competition.Following the three-match ODI series in Australia, India's next ODI engagement will be a home series against South Africa in December, also comprising three matches.The 2026 calendar is packed with ODI cricket for India, featuring series against multiple nations. These include matches against New Zealand in January and October, Afghanistan in June, England in July, and the West Indies in September.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Run-hungry Sarfaraz Khan offers reminder of Test availability
Sarfaraz Khan showcased his batting prowess with a remarkable century in the Buchi Babu tournament. His innings helped Mumbai post a strong total. Suved Parkar and Aakash Parkar also contributed with half-centuries. Sarfaraz's performance highlights his determination to regain a spot in the Indian Test team.
Run-hungry Sarfaraz Khan offers reminder of Test availability | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsRun-hungry Sarfaraz Khan offers reminder of Test availabilityTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaRun-hungry Sarfaraz Khan offers reminder of Test availabilityShrivathsan S / TNN / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 12:37 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSarfaraz Khan showcased his batting prowess with a remarkable century in the Buchi Babu tournament. His innings helped Mumbai post a strong total. Suved Parkar and Aakash Parkar also contributed with half-centuries. Sarfaraz's performance highlights his determination to regain a spot in the Indian Test team. Sarfaraz Khan (PTI Photo) CHENNAI: When some of his Mumbai teammates and TNCA XI players were waiting for the curtains to come down following a rain interruption towards the end of Monday’s play, Sarfaraz Khan was itching to get back on the field. Sarfaraz, who had retired hurt with cramps after smashing 138 (114 balls, 10x4, 6x6), had his pads on and was craving for more on the opening day of the Buchi Babu invitational red-ball tournament at the Gojan ‘B’ Ground here. Courtesy of his stroke-filled ton and halfcenturies from Suved Parkar (72) and Aakash Parkar (67 not out), Mumbai posted a handsome first-innings score of 367-5 at stumps. How Virat Kohli & Ravi Shastri sparked India's Test revolution | Insights from Bharat Arun | #BSEGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The hunger that Sarfaraz showed reflected the burning desire which he has to get back to India’s Test set-up. The 27-year-old only warmed the bench during the BorderGavaskar Trophy in Australia and was ignored for the recent tour to England. Playing his first competitive longformat match since turning out for India ‘A’ against England Lions, the right-hander, on Monday, was fully immersed in the task of accumulating runs. So much so that he had to be informed by his teammates after completing his century on the stroke of tea. The Mumbai batter brought up his milestone with a Virender Sehwag-esque upper cut over the wicketkeeper’s head, which resulted in a boundary. Up against a not-so-strong bowling attack, Sarfaraz made TNCA XI pay heavily for their drops. He was handed reprieves – both off left-arm spinner M Siddharth’s bowling – on 15 and 121 before deciding to leave the field with cramps. Sarfaraz was particularly severe on the two slow bowlers, Siddharth (he hit him for 49 runs off 42 balls) and off-spinning allrounder Mohamed Ali (28 off 14 balls), as he treated them with disdain. He used his slog-sweeps to good effect to collect many fours in the square leg-midwicket region while opting to access the ‘V’ when trying to clear the fence. Besides his attractive strokemaking, what caught the eye was his eagerness to run hard between the wickets. He put his speed boots on quite a few times, one of the notable moments being him pinching a single a few minutes before suffering a minor setback. Having a leaner frame, a result of his recent transformation, may have helped him in the cause. Sarfaraz, once overlooked by the national selectors for fitness issues despite amassing loads of runs, shed about 17 kgs in a short time in his bid to once again climb to the top. Sarfaraz’s brother Musheer Khan hailed him for putting on another good show. “My bhai has made it a habit to hit tons. We have a good score and hope to score more in the remaining overs (on Tuesday),” Musheer said in a post-day chat.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4.
