For chairman Ajit Agarkar and his colleagues, the dilemma is whether to tinker with a winning combination that hardly needs fixing.India’s problem of plenty makes the decision even harder. With at least 30 players ready to step in and multiple contenders for every role, the selectors have the luxury—and the headache—of choice. For the top three batting slots alone, six players are in contention.Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Tilak Varma impressed last season in India colours, while Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and IPL Orange Cap winner Sai Sudharsan are equally strong options.The bowling unit has its own battles. Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Ravi Bishnoi are vying for one place, while the experienced Yuzvendra Chahal continues to be overlooked.Within team management, opinions differ. One faction believes it would be unfair to drop a regular performer just to make room for a bigger name. The other sees Gill as the future face of Indian cricket, an all-format captain and a marketable brand who should naturally slot in.But transition won’t be simple. Under Suryakumar Yadav’s leadership, India has won 17 of its last 20 T20Is—a remarkable 85% success rate—without Gill or Jaiswal in the mix. Both, however, had previously performed well in T20Is and the IPL before Test commitments kept them away.Gill even served as vice-captain to Suryakumar before stepping aside, with Axar Patel stepping in as deputy. If Gill returns, Axar could justifiably feel hard done by, despite his solid leadership stint.If Gill is included in the 15, the selectors will face the tougher call of slotting him into the playing XI. That would likely push out one of Sanju, Abhishek, or Tilak. Another possible casualty is Rinku Singh, whose finishing role has diminished under head coach Gautam Gambhir, who does not believe in the idea of a “designated finisher.”India Asia Cup 2025 Squad Announcement Live Update: The biggest challenge before India’s selection committee on Tuesday will be finding a way to accommodate Shubman Gill in a well-settled T20 side for next month’s Asia Cup in the UAE.

Gill, fresh from a dream run as Test captain in England, has not quite found a natural place in the current T20 set-up that will compete in the continental event from September 9 to 28. For chairman Ajit Agarkar and his colleagues, the dilemma is whether to tinker with a winning combination that hardly needs fixing.

India’s problem of plenty makes the decision even harder. With at least 30 players ready to step in and multiple contenders for every role, the selectors have the luxury—and the headache—of choice. For the top three batting slots alone, six players are in contention.

Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, and Tilak Varma impressed last season in India colours, while Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and IPL Orange Cap winner Sai Sudharsan are equally strong options.

The bowling unit has its own battles. Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Ravi Bishnoi are vying for one place, while the experienced Yuzvendra Chahal continues to be overlooked.

Within team management, opinions differ. One faction believes it would be unfair to drop a regular performer just to make room for a bigger name. The other sees Gill as the future face of Indian cricket, an all-format captain and a marketable brand who should naturally slot in.

But transition won’t be simple. Under Suryakumar Yadav’s leadership, India has won 17 of its last 20 T20Is—a remarkable 85% success rate—without Gill or Jaiswal in the mix. Both, however, had previously performed well in T20Is and the IPL before Test commitments kept them away.

Gill even served as vice-captain to Suryakumar before stepping aside, with Axar Patel stepping in as deputy. If Gill returns, Axar could justifiably feel hard done by, despite his solid leadership stint.

If Gill is included in the 15, the selectors will face the tougher call of slotting him into the playing XI. That would likely push out one of Sanju, Abhishek, or Tilak. Another possible casualty is Rinku Singh, whose finishing role has diminished under head coach Gautam Gambhir, who does not believe in the idea of a “designated finisher.”TrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs BIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Rabada ruled out; Maphaka added
Kagiso Rabada is sidelined from the ODI series against Australia due to an ankle injury, paving the way for Kwena Maphaka's inclusion. Meanwhile, Dewald Brevis is poised to make his ODI debut after a strong T20I performance. Temba Bavuma returns to lead the team after recovering from a hamstring injury, bolstering the squad alongside other additions.
BIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Kagiso Rabada ruled out with ankle injury vs Australia; Kwena Maphaka added | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsBIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Kagiso Rabada ruled out with ankle injury vs Australia; Kwena Maphaka addedTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaBIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Kagiso Rabada ruled out with ankle injury vs Australia; Kwena Maphaka addedTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 19, 2025, 09:41 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKagiso Rabada is sidelined from the ODI series against Australia due to an ankle injury, paving the way for Kwena Maphaka's inclusion. Meanwhile, Dewald Brevis is poised to make his ODI debut after a strong T20I performance. Temba Bavuma returns to lead the team after recovering from a hamstring injury, bolstering the squad alongside other additions. Kagiso Rabada, right, of South Africa celebrates with teammates after taking the wicket of Tim David of Australia during the T20 cricket international between Australia and South Africa at Cazaly's Stadium in Cairns, Australia. AP/PTI(AP08_16_2025_000313A) South Africa's spearhead Kagiso Rabada has been ruled out of the three-match One-Day International series against Australia, starting Tuesday, due to inflammation of his right ankle, Cricket South Africa (CSA) said in a statement."The 30-year-old underwent a scan on Monday, which confirmed the extent of the injury. He will remain in Australia and undergo rehabilitation under the supervision of the Proteas medical staff," CSA said.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Rabada has been replaced by 19-year-old Kwena Maphaka, who was sensational in the recently concluded T20I series.Maphaka picked up nine wickets in three games.The left-arm pacer already has two ODI caps and could be in the starting eleven as South Africa seek to put up a strong challenge against Australia.Brevis, meanwhile, is almost certain to make his ODI debut after a stellar T20I series saw him smash a rollicking 41-ball century in Darwin and follow it up with a blazing half-century in Cairns to finish with 180 runs, making him the top run-scorer across both teams.South Africa’s ODI skipper Temba Bavuma said he had been impressed by Brevis’ form. "It's always exciting when you see the young faces. Obviously, the big talk has been on Brevis, (he's been) putting up his hand and showing what he is capable of. (I'm) excited to see what he can also bring within the one-day stuff," said Bavuma to reporters on Monday.PollWho do you think will have a bigger impact in the ODI series?Kwena MaphakaDewald BrevisTemba BavumaKeshav MaharajThe ODI series also marks Bavuma’s return to competitive cricket after leading South Africa to their maiden ICC World Test Championship crown at Lord’s in June. Bavuma, 34, has recovered from the hamstring injury sustained during the WTC final and confirmed he will bat at number three behind openers Ryan Rickelton and Aiden Markram.Bavuma is one of five players added to South Africa’s ODI squad alongside veteran spinner Keshav Maharaj, all-rounder Wiaan Mulder, and top-order batters Matthew Breetzke and Tony de Zorzi. After the series opener in Cairns on Tuesday, both teams will move to Mackay for the next two games to be held on Friday and Sunday.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous'Coolie' actress Rachita Ram's most gorgeous picturesEntertainmentPreity Mukhundhan radiates eleganceEntertainmentNeha Harsora’s dazzling and dreamy ethnic lookstvBigg Boss Malayalam 7: Stunning weekend looks of the contestantstvFun facts about the Param Sundari actor Sidharth MalhotraEntertainment8 simple habits that will help reduce stress on the eyes and improve vision naturallyLifestyle8 times Samantha Ruth Prabhu turned perfect muse for Krésha BajajLifestyleSaree tales by actress Nisha RavikrishnantvManasi Parekh Serves Style & SmilesEntertainment10 celebrity-inspired Indian baby boy namesLifestyle Next123Top Sports NewsIndia Asia Cup SquadWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementRohit SharmaShoaib BashirSaaniya ChandhokSunil GavaskarTop TrendingPatrick MahomesAntonio BrownRaheem MorrisJoy TaylorTravis Hunters WifeOlivia Paige DunneMartina NavratilovaMarco BelinelliPatrick MahomesTravis KelceTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn SportsEntire WebsiteIndia Asia Cup squad announcement Live: Selectors face tough callBIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spotlight on Shafali Verma

Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced today  - The Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIcricketAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreICC RankingsWTC StandingsCricket ScheduleIND vs ENGIPL 2025Champions TrophyMLCToday's ePaperWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayCommentaryNewsSports NewsCricket NewsWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayLIVE NOWTHE TIMES OF INDIA | Aug 19, 2025, 12:29:53 ISTShareFollow us Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: All eyes on Shafali Verma; Women’s ODI World Cup squad likely to be announced todayWomen's World Cup India Team Squad Live: India's women's cricket selection panel, led by Neetu David, will convene in Mumbai on Tuesday to pick the ODI World Cup squad, with key decisions pending on including Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur. The tournament, featuring eight teams, will begin September 30 with India hosting all matches except Pakistan's games, which will be played in Colombo.   India enters the World Cup with strong momentum after defeating England in white-ball series and winning the ODI tri-series involving Sri Lanka and South Africa in April. The team will also host Australia for three ODIs as part of their preparation.   The selectors face a crucial decision regarding Shafali Verma's inclusion in the batting lineup. Since her return against England, she has shown mixed form with scores of 3, 47, 31, and 75, followed by underwhelming performances against Australia A scoring 3, 3, and 41.   The current batting order appears settled with Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal opening, supported by Jemimah Rodrigues, Harleen Deol, and captain Harmanpreet Kaur in the middle order.   Renuka Thakur's fitness assessment will be another key consideration. The premier seam bowler has been sidelined since March, and her recovery status will be evaluated considering the upcoming World Cup's workload demands.   Richa Ghosh is set to be the primary wicketkeeper, with Yastika Bhatia, who recently scored two fifties against Australia A in Brisbane, as a potential backup. 12:29 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Tournament Details OutThe ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 will run from September 30 to November 2. Hosts India will kick off their campaign against Sri Lanka at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru, with matches to be spread across multiple venues.12:13 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Update from Mumbai&mdash; toi_gauravG (@toi_gauravG) 12:05 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Road to Redemption After 2017 HeartbreakIndia will look to go one better than in 2017, when they lost a nail-biting final to England at Lord’s. Harmanpreet & Co. now aim to finally bring home the Women’s World Cup trophy, riding on the momentum of the WPL and recent series wins.11:52 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: India’s World Cup HistoryThe 2025 edition will be the first senior ICC Women’s event in the sub-continent since 2016. India has hosted the Women’s World Cup thrice before — in 1978, 1997 and 2013. The tournament returns to familiar soil at a time when women’s cricket in India is booming like never before.11:41 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Update&mdash; AraniBasuTOI (@AraniBasuTOI) 11:36 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: ICC CEO on Women’s Cricket & India’s ProgressAt the '50 Days to Go' event recently, the ICC CEO Sanjog Gupta said the rise of women’s cricket mirrors India’s progress. “World Cups are more than events; they are apertures for building legacies and cultures. This World Cup can be the springboard for the game’s next leap,” he stressed.11:31 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Countdown beginsThe Women’s World Cup kicks off on September 30 in Bengaluru, with India facing Sri Lanka in the opening match at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium. With the WPL pipeline strengthening India’s squad depth and players like Smriti Mandhana and Jemimah Rodrigues leading the charge, the hosts are aiming to finally lift the trophy after coming agonisingly close in 2017.11:15 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: UPDATEKindly note that the first press conference is expected to be delayed owing to weather disruptions.11:00 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live:  A Memory of 2017Jemimah recalled her own early days as a fan, when she went to the airport in 2017 to welcome back the Indian team after their heartbreaking final defeat. “At 5:30 am the whole airport was packed with fans. Back then, for women’s cricket, that wasn’t normal. The players were shocked to see so many people,” she said, calling it a turning point for the women’s game in India.10:46 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Jemimah on WPL EffectWith 50 days to go for the ICC Women’s World Cup 2025, Jemimah Rodrigues credited the Women’s Premier League for giving young players the confidence to excel on the international stage. She highlighted pacer Kranti Gaud’s fearless bowling in England, where the 22-year-old emerged as the leading wicket-taker with nine scalps, including a stunning six-for.10:39 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live:  Focus on Present, Not MilestonesFresh from series wins in England (2-1 T20Is, 3-2 ODIs), Mandhana stressed that the team is concentrating only on preparations. “Whenever we’ve done well, everything else has taken care of itself. We’ve had a camp, the England tour, and one more before the World Cup — that’s our focus,” she noted.10:21 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Lessons from 2017 World CupMandhana recalled India’s memorable 2017 campaign, where she scored 232 runs, including a century vs West Indies. “We all remember that World Cup… Harmanpreet’s 171, everyone’s contribution. The welcome from fans afterwards changed everything for women’s cricket in India,” she said, reliving the turning point.10:11 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Mandhana on India’s New MindsetWith 50 days left for the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025, opener Smriti Mandhana says India’s calm and focused mindset is their biggest strength. “The mindset has changed… there’s a calmness with which I want to go about the field. We know where to work hard and how to implement,” she told ICC.09:45 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Confidence from recent winsWith India set to open their campaign against Sri Lanka on September 30 in Bengaluru, Harmanpreet believes the team carries strong momentum. “The confidence is very high. The kind of cricket we have played over the last couple of years, especially in England, gives us a lot of belief,” the skipper said recently.Don't missanything!Subscribe to our newsletter and get all the stories that matter delivered to your inboxInvalid id. Please enter againBy subscribing to newsletter, you acknowledge our privacy policy09:22 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Reliving the 171 Knock*Harmanpreet reflected on her unforgettable 171* against Australia in the 2017 semi-final, calling it a turning point for women’s cricket in India. “That knock was special for me and for women’s cricket. At the time I didn’t realise its impact, but when we came back, the support we received was overwhelming,” she said.09:18 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Harmanpreet’s world cup missionIndia captain Harmanpreet Kaur says her approach to the upcoming ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup will be “the same as my first ODI World Cup” — to enjoy her game while giving 100%. Leading in her maiden World Cup as skipper, Kaur is determined to “break that final barrier” and deliver India’s first senior ICC trophy.09:02 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Winning at home would be hugeMithali stressed that clinching the Cup in India would be a landmark moment for women’s cricket in the country. “We’ve come close twice, but never lifted it. Winning at home would be special, not just for players but for every fan,” she told ICC Digital, highlighting how the victory could inspire future generations.08:54 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Mithali Raj’s Big MessageFormer India skipper Mithali Raj has underlined the importance of “seizing crucial moments” if India are to lift their maiden Women’s ODI World Cup on home soil. Raj, who led India to finals in 2005 and 2017, believes momentum-shifting passages decide big games and could separate champions from contenders.08:45 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Men's Asia Cup selection squadToday squad for the men's Asia Cup is also be announced. Stay tuned!08:42 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Rising stars push for inclusionKranti Goud’s six-wicket haul against England and Yastika Bhatia’s twin fifties for India A have strengthened their cases. Add to that the fitness cloud over all-rounder Amanjot Kaur, and the selectors face a tricky puzzle to maintain depth and balance in Harmanpreet Kaur’s side.08:42 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spin options aboundWith the World Cup in the subcontinent, spinners will be in high demand. Deepti Sharma, Sneh Rana and Radha Yadav remain the frontline options, while youngster N Shree Charani impressed in T20Is against England. The selectors must balance experience with youth in India’s spin-heavy arsenal.08:41 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Renuka Thakur’s Fitness TestThe status of pacer Renuka Thakur is a major concern. Out since March with injury, the right-arm quick could prove crucial with the new ball in Indian conditions. The upcoming ODI series against Australia may act as her comeback stage, provided she clears fitness and workload assessments.08:40 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: Spotlight on Shafali VermaShafali Verma’s inclusion remains the talking point. Since her return against England, she scored 3, 47, 31 and 75, but faltered in the Australia A series with twin failures (3, 3, 41). Will the selectors risk disrupting the stable opening pair of Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal to inject Shafali’s firepower?08:40 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup Squad Live: Selection Meeting UnderwayThe women’s selection panel, headed by Neetu David, is meeting today to finalise India’s squad for the ODI World Cup starting September 30. With recent wins over England and South Africa boosting confidence, all eyes are on whether Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur make the cut.08:38 (IST) Aug 19Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: WelcomeHello and welcome to our live coverage of the Women's World Cup squad announcement. The women’s selection panel, headed by Neetu David, will face some tricky questions on the inclusion of Shafali Verma and pacer Renuka Thakur when it meets here on Tuesday to pick the squad for the ODI World Cup.We'll be bringing you all the live updates. Stay tuned. Women's World Cup India Team Squad Live: The selection committee led by Neetu David is set to announce India's Women's ODI World Cup squad and the team for the three-match home ODI series against Australia on Tuesday afternoon. The same squad is likely to be chosen for both events, with only minimal changes possible based on the decisions of the five-member selection committee and team management.

The selection committee is also expected to pick an India A team for the World Cup warm-up game against South Africa at the BCCI Centre of Excellence Ground in Bengaluru.

The first two women's ODIs between India and Australia will be held at the Mullanpur stadium on September 14 and 17, followed by the final match at New Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium on September 20.

Mullanpur will host women's international cricket for the first time, while New Delhi will stage a women's ODI after nearly 28 years.

The Indian team, under Harmanpreet Kaur's leadership, enters its final World Cup preparation phase after successful ODI tri-series victory in Sri Lanka and white-ball series wins in England.

Smriti Mandhana, Harmanpreet Kaur, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Richa Ghosh are confirmed for the batting lineup. Pratika Rawal, who has scored 703 runs since her debut last year, and Harleen Deol are likely to continue, with Yastika Bhatia as second wicketkeeper.

Shafali Verma's selection remains uncertain due to inconsistent performance. Despite head coach Amol Muzumdar indicating her consideration for World Cup selection, her recent scores in Australia have been modest.

Amanjot Kaur, who replaced the injured Pooja Vastrakar, faces careful workload management due to a back injury from the England ODI series. While cleared to play, she might be reserved for crucial World Cup matches.TrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI India squad: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as opener
The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup, with Abhishek Sharma's selection a near certainty. His explosive IPL seasons and international success, including topping the ICC T20I batting rankings, make him indispensable. Sharma's formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson and consistent performances solidify his place as India's T20I spearhead.
India squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as opener | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIndia squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as openerTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaIndia squad for 2025 Asia Cup: Why Abhishek Sharma is a non-negotiable as openerHijam Raju Singh / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 10:56 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup, with Abhishek Sharma's selection a near certainty. His explosive IPL seasons and international success, including topping the ICC T20I batting rankings, make him indispensable. Sharma's formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson and consistent performances solidify his place as India's T20I spearhead. Abhishek Sharma has staked his claim at the top of the order in India's T20 team.  The Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee will convene at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Tuesday to pick India’s squad for the 2025 Asia Cup. The tournament, scheduled in the UAE from September 9–28, will be played in the T20I format, making it an important stepping stone towards the T20 World Cup next year.LIVE: Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIndia, placed in Group A alongside Pakistan, UAE, and Oman, will be watched closely as the selectors look to strike the balance between experience and youth. One name, however, should not even be up for debate — Abhishek Sharma.EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'From IPL sensation to India’s T20I spearheadAbhishek Sharma’s case for selection writes itself. His rise has been meteoric since his breakthrough IPL 2024 season for Sunrisers Hyderabad, where he hammered 484 runs at a staggering strike rate of 204.21.And if anyone thought 2024 was a one-off, Abhishek proved them wrong with another breathtaking IPL in 2025: 439 runs, which included a highest score of 141, at another stunning strike rate of 193.39. PollDo you believe the selectors should prioritize experience over youth in the squad selection?Yes, experience is crucialNo, youth brings energyThat form translated to the international stage almost instantly. After an anticlimactic four-ball duck on debut against Zimbabwe in July 2024, he responded with a jaw-dropping 100 off 47 balls in the very next match. Since then, the 24-year-old left-hander has not looked back, cementing his place at the top of India’s T20I order.Fast forward a year, and Abhishek sits at the very top of the ICC T20I batting rankings, making him the youngest Indian ever to achieve the No. 1 status in the format. He currently leads the chart ahead of compatriots Tilak Varma (No.2) and Suryakumar Yadav (No.6). That alone is a telling indicator of his indispensability.The numbers don’t lieIndia batter Abhishek Sharma. In 16 T20I innings for India, Abhishek has amassed 535 runs at a blistering strike rate of 193.85 — the highest for any Indian with over 500 runs in the format. His record already features two centuries and two fifties, underlining his ability to provide explosive starts and play match-winning knocks.His most recent masterpiece came against England at the Wankhede Stadium, where he smashed a record-breaking 135 off 54 balls — the highest individual T20I score by an Indian. That innings included 13 sixes and showcased his unmatched ability to dismantle world-class bowling.Crucially, Abhishek has formed a formidable opening partnership with Sanju Samson. Since being paired together against Bangladesh in October 2024, the duo have opened in 12 consecutive matches, giving India explosive starts almost every time.Abhishek Sharma in last 12 T20Is: 411 runs @34.25, SR 200.49 (2 fifties, 1 hundred)Sanju Samson in last 12 T20Is: 417 runs @37.91, SR 183.70 (3 hundreds)India’s record with Abhishek-Samson opening: 10 wins in 12 matchesThese numbers reflect not just individual brilliance but also a stable, high-impact opening formula that has worked wonders for India. The competition: Shubman Gill and Yashasvi JaiswalAbhishek Sharma, Shubman Gill and Yashasvi JaiswalThe selection dilemma lies in who joins Abhishek and Samson as the third opener. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, both coming off a prolific Test series in England, will stake their claims. But their T20I credentials have faded in comparison.Jaiswal’s last T20I: July 2024 vs Sri Lanka (10 off 9).Gill’s last T20I: Same match, scoring 39 off 37.Neither has played a T20I in more than a year, while Abhishek has established himself as India’s most consistent powerplay batter. Given the contrasting trajectories, the selectors may consider carrying either Gill or Jaiswal as backup, but dislodging Abhishek is not an option.Why Abhishek Sharma is non-negotiableWorld No.1 T20I batter – His ranking is a reflection of dominance across opponents and conditions.Explosive strike rate – At nearly 194 in internationals and 193.39 in IPL 2025, his scoring rate dwarfs not just Indian contemporaries but also most global stars.Big-match temperament – Two T20I hundreds already, including a record knock against England, underline his ability to step up.Proven opening partnership – The Abhishek-Samson duo has become India’s most reliable T20I opening combo in recent years.Consistency – Back-to-back stellar IPL seasons, apart from international success, have made him the most bankable young T20 batter in India.As India gear up for the Asia Cup, much chatter will swirl around Shubman Gill’s return, Yashasvi Jaiswal’s case, or middle-order reshuffles. But in the opening slot, there is no ambiguity. Abhishek Sharma has evolved from a promising IPL star into India’s T20I batting spearhead, with numbers, form, and rankings all backing his claim.The selectors may face tough calls in other departments, but when it comes to Abhishek, the decision is straightforward. He is not just a part of India’s Asia Cup squad — he is the foundation on which their T20 future must be built.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Why Kuldeep and Varun could make for a lethal combo in Asia Cup
Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement, hoping to showcase their spin prowess. Kuldeep, after a stint on the sidelines in England, aims to reignite his T20I form, while Varun looks to continue his impressive international return. Their coach believes their partnership could be a formidable weapon for India in the tournament.
Why an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia Cup | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsWhy an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia CupTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinWhy an 'upset' Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy could make for a lethal combo in the Asia CupAmit Kumar / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 08:28 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy eagerly await the Asia Cup 2025 squad announcement, hoping to showcase their spin prowess. Kuldeep, after a stint on the sidelines in England, aims to reignite his T20I form, while Varun looks to continue his impressive international return. Their coach believes their partnership could be a formidable weapon for India in the tournament. Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy  NEW DELHI: The spin duo of Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy will be eagerly awaiting the selectors’ call as India’s squad for the Asia Cup 2025, scheduled from September 9, is set to be announced. Both would be keen to get their hands on leather and rattle the opposition.The two spinners come into the tournament with different recent history.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'Kuldeep spent the entire tour of England on the bench. Carrying drinks, passing on messages from the coaching staff, and quietly watching his teammates from the dressing room was all the chinaman managed over five Tests.Now, with the Asia Cup squad to be revealed on Tuesday (August 19), Kuldeep will be hoping to don the India blues, even if he didn't get the chance to wear the whites.The 30-year-old last featured in a T20I in the 2024 T20 World Cup, where he picked up 10 wickets in five matches. Overall, Kuldeep has played 40 T20Is, claiming 69 wickets, including two five-wicket hauls.Known for his deceptive wrong ’uns and sharp flippers, he remains a potent threat to batters, especially in UAE's spin-friendly conditions.While Kuldeep hasn’t played a T20I in the UAE, he has featured in ODIs there. He was also part of India’s victorious squads in the 2018 and 2023 editions of the Asia Cup (both in the ODI format).PollWhat is the key factor for India to succeed in the Asia Cup 2025?Strong batting lineupBowling partnershipsFielding and fitnessTeam strategy and preparationVarun Chakravarthy, meanwhile, has been in excellent form since making his international return last year.The 33-year-old mystery spinner, armed with nine different variations, has already produced match-winning spells, including two five-wicket hauls in T20Is and another in ODIs during India’s ICC Champions Trophy triumph.In his short T20I career so far, he has bagged 33 wickets in 18 matches.PlayerMatchesWktsBBIBBMAveEconSR4w5wKuldeep Yadav40695/175/1714.076.7712.412Varun Chakravarthy18335/175/1714.577.0212.402Kuldeep’s coach Kapil Pandey believes both bowlers are primed to shine at the Asia Cup and could form a dangerous partnership with Varun."Every cricketer feels upset if he doesn’t get a chance. Kuldeep was sad too. But I told him — whatever has gone is gone, it’s time to look forward. He is really looking forward to a chance in the Asia Cup. He is hungry for wickets. India will benefit hugely from Kuldeep. And if he forms a combo with Varun, then the opposition will have a tough time. Varun is a solid bowler. They both complement each other when on the field," Kapil told TimesofIndia.com."Opposition teams were scared of Kuldeep, and now they are scared of Varun too. If India play Pakistan, it will be a night to remember. These two guys will completely outfox them. They will not give them time to think. Kuldeep is very hungry right now," the coach added.India have been placed in Group A alongside Oman, hosts UAE, and arch-rivals Pakistan. Group B consists of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Hong Kong, and Sri Lanka.With the Asia Cup followed by the 2026 T20 World Cup, the tournament provides both Kuldeep and Varun with the perfect opportunity to stake their claim for long-term spots in India’s T20I setup.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Surya's catch
Ambati Rayudu has revealed that the boundary rope in the T20 World Cup final between India and South Africa was unintentionally moved back due to broadcast equipment. This adjustment, according to Rayudu, played a crucial role in Suryakumar Yadav's catch to dismiss David Miller. Despite the controversy, Rayudu maintains the catch was legitimate, attributing India's triumph to divine intervention.
Big revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsBig revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCHTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokSuryakumar YadavShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinBig revelation! 'Pushed the rope backwards': Ex-cricketer on Suryakumar Yadav's T20 World Cup final catch - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAmbati Rayudu has revealed that the boundary rope in the T20 World Cup final between India and South Africa was unintentionally moved back due to broadcast equipment. This adjustment, according to Rayudu, played a crucial role in Suryakumar Yadav's catch to dismiss David Miller. Despite the controversy, Rayudu maintains the catch was legitimate, attributing India's triumph to divine intervention. Suryakumar Yadav NEW DELHI: Former Indian cricketer Ambati Rayudu has shed new light on one of the most debated moments from the T20 World Cup 2024 final between India and South Africa — Suryakumar Yadav’s boundary catch to dismiss David Miller. According to Rayudu, the catch became possible because the boundary rope had been unintentionally pushed back earlier in the day when broadcast equipment was placed near the rope.Rayudu’s revelation comes more than a year after India’s title-winning final against South Africa, where Suryakumar’s stunning effort at the boundary was remembered as one of the defining moments.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'The dismissal, which turned out to be a defining moment in India’s triumph, drew scrutiny when replays showed the rope appeared to be positioned differently than usual.Speaking on the Unfiltered Podcast, Rayudu, who was part of the commentary team during the final, explained: "There were world feed commentators. During the break, what usually happens is they put a chair there and a screen in order to help the broadcasters see what is happening. That is why they pushed the rope backwards a little bit. But, they left it like that (even after taking the screen and the chair away). That is how the boundary became a little bigger for us. We (the commentators) could see it from above. It was god's plan."When asked whether the shot would have cleared the boundary under normal circumstances, Rayudu replied:PollDo you agree with Rayudu's statement that 'God was with us'?Yes, it's a matter of fateNo, skill was the deciding factorI think it's a mix of bothI don't believe in fate"I don't know if it was a six (in natural circumstances) or not. If the rope had been placed at its normal position, maybe Surya would've run from inside."Despite the controversy, Rayudu insisted the dismissal was legitimate. "End of the day, God was with us," he said, adding that it was a “clean catch.”The rope placement sparked reactions from several current and former cricketers at the time, though the debate eventually faded. Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Rohit Sharma beats rain, takes his favourite car for a spin in Mumbai - WATCH
Rohit Sharma, unfazed by Mumbai's monsoon, was recently seen driving his Range Rover. The cricket star also added a Lamborghini Urus SE to his collection, sporting a personalised number plate reflecting his children's birthdays and jersey number. While enjoying his luxurious cars, Sharma is preparing for his potential final international series in Australia this October.
Rohit Sharma beats rain, takes his favourite car for a spin in Mumbai - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsRohit Sharma beats rain, takes his favourite car for a spin in Mumbai - WATCHTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaRohit Sharma beats rain, takes his favourite car for a spin in Mumbai - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:13 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRohit Sharma, unfazed by Mumbai's monsoon, was recently seen driving his Range Rover. The cricket star also added a Lamborghini Urus SE to his collection, sporting a personalised number plate reflecting his children's birthdays and jersey number. While enjoying his luxurious cars, Sharma is preparing for his potential final international series in Australia this October. Rohit Sharma NEW DELHI: Not even heavy Mumbai rains can keep Rohit Sharma indoors. The Indian cricket star was recently spotted driving his sleek black Range Rover through the city, enjoying the monsoon showers in style.The Range Rover is one of Rohit’s trusted rides, but it’s far from the only head-turner in his enviable garage. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!EXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh on Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Shubman Gill, India vs Pakistan and moreJust a couple of days ago, the 37-year-old added a fiery red Lamborghini Urus SE to his growing luxury car collection and wasted no time taking it out for a drive. Fans quickly gathered on the streets of Mumbai as Rohit, behind the wheel of the brand-new SUV, cruised through the city.What caught everyone’s attention, apart from the stunning machine itself, was the personalised number plate — 3015. The digits carry deep personal meaning, combining his daughter Samaira’s birthday (December 30) and son Ahaan’s birthday (November 15). Together, the numbers add up to 45, Rohit’s iconic jersey number. His previous car carried the number 264, a nod to his world-record ODI score against Sri Lanka in 2014.The Urus SE itself is a beast on wheels, packing 800hp and 950Nm of torque, capable of hitting 0–100 km/h in just 3.4 seconds. Priced at around Rs 4.57 crore (ex-showroom), it is the latest jewel in a collection that also includes a BMW M5 (Rs 1.99 crore), Mercedes-Benz GLS 400d (Rs 1.58 crore), Mercedes-Benz S-Class (Rs 1.98 crore), and a Range Rover HSE LWB (Rs 3.68 crore).WATCH:While his garage continues to expand, Rohit’s cricketing journey is entering a decisive phase. Having last turned out for the Mumbai Indians in IPL 2025, he is gearing up for what could be his final international series. With the Bangladesh ODIs in August cancelled, India’s next assignment will be a three-match ODI series in Australia from October 19–25, where Rohit is expected to make a return.For now, the former India captain seems to be striking the perfect balance — working hard on his cricket while enjoying life off the field, whether it’s in the nets or behind the wheel of his favourite cars.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open as Sinner retires
Carlos Alcaraz secured the Cincinnati Open title. Jannik Sinner, the defending champion, retired due to illness early in the final. Sinner's focus shifts to recovery for the US Open. Alcaraz expressed sympathy for Sinner and satisfaction with his own victory. He looks forward to performing well at the US Open.
Carlos Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open as Jannik Sinner retires | Tennis News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsTennisCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMABadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePapertennisUS Open 2024Australian Open 2025French Open 2025Wimbledon 2024Tennis VideosNewsSports NewsTennis NewsTop Stories NewsTennis NewsCarlos Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open as Jannik Sinner retiresTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinCarlos Alcaraz wins Cincinnati Open as Jannik Sinner retiresAFP /  Aug 19, 2025, 07:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeCarlos Alcaraz secured the Cincinnati Open title. Jannik Sinner, the defending champion, retired due to illness early in the final. Sinner's focus shifts to recovery for the US Open. Alcaraz expressed sympathy for Sinner and satisfaction with his own victory. He looks forward to performing well at the US Open. Carlos Alcaraz   CINCINNATI: Carlos Alcaraz won the ATP Cincinnati Open title on Monday after defending champion Jannik Sinner retired due to illness in the first set. World number one Sinner came into the final feeling unwell and lost the first seven points of the match before throwing in the towel at 5-0 down in a game played in 30-degree Celsius heat. Sinner will now focus on recovery with the US Open starting on Sunday. The Italian is due to take part in the US Open's revamped mixed doubles on Tuesday, but his participation in that draw is now in serious doubt.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I'm disappointed, I didn't feel great from yesterday," Sinner said afterwards. "During the night, I thought I would recover a bit better, but it was not the case. "I just tried to go out for the fans, trying to give (them) a match - that's the reason why I went on the court."But it was not meant to be for me today. But I don't want to take anything away from Carlos. He had a great week, great, great tournament again."Sinner said he is now pointing to the final Grand Slam of the season."The main focus, obviously, is for the US Open. Recovery is the most important. And then we see," he said.Despite the temporary health setback, Sinner is pleased with his showings in 2025."I feel like it's an incredible season," he said. "We'll keep going, keep pushing. I have some points to improve if I want to go far in US Open. "It was a good test this week, trying to understand where my level is."Sinner lasted for just 22 minutes, calling for the doctor after losing the fifth game and shortly after going to shake hands with Alcaraz. - Alcaraz eyes New York -It was the second match in a row Alcaraz had won over an ailing opponent, following his win over Alexander Zverev in the semi-finals. Alcaraz won his 22nd career title as he claimed his 17th victory in a row at the Masters 1000 level. He now leads Sinner 9-5 and lost to the Italian in their last match, the Wimbledon final last month."Obviously it's not the way that I wanted to win the final," the Spaniard said. "First of all, I just want to wish Jannik a speedy recovery. Hopefully in a few days he's going to be okay to prepare and practice well to the US Open."For myself, I'm just really, really happy to be able to leave the with trophy, since I just lost that final in 2023 (to Novak Djokovic) I just wanted really, really badly this, this trophy, so I just really proud and happy to be able to lift it."Former Open winner Alcaraz, who was upset in the second round a year ago, is looking forward to a more respectable showing in New York."I'm feeling a lot of confidence. New York is a place that I love playing...it is where I got my first Grand Slam."I appreciate the love and the support that I received there every every year... last year it was disappointing, the level that I played there. "So this year, I really want to show my really good tennis, my best tennis, try to go as far as I can, enjoy as much as I can."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup 2025: Key talking points ahead of India's squad selection
Indian selectors are set to finalize the Asia Cup squad, prioritizing T20 specialists and continuity. Suryakumar Yadav is likely to continue as captain, while Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma may open. Despite a strong IPL, Shubman Gill might be excluded, with Jaiswal preferred. Bumrah is available, and the spin attack will feature Chakravarthy, Yadav, Sundar, and Patel.
Asia Cup 2025: Key talking points ahead of India's squad selection | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Key talking points ahead of India's squad selectionTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaAsia Cup 2025: Key talking points ahead of India's squad selectionHindol Basu / TNN /  Aug 19, 2025, 10:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIndian selectors are set to finalize the Asia Cup squad, prioritizing T20 specialists and continuity. Suryakumar Yadav is likely to continue as captain, while Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma may open. Despite a strong IPL, Shubman Gill might be excluded, with Jaiswal preferred. Bumrah is available, and the spin attack will feature Chakravarthy, Yadav, Sundar, and Patel. Mohammed Siraj, Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill (AFP Photo) India’s selectors meet on Tuesday to finalise the squad for the Asia Cup in the UAE. TOI looks into the issues they are likely to discuss... Focus on T20 specialists: Indian selectors aim to maintain continuity and back young T20I specialists. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Surya secure as leader? Suryakumar Yadav, after clearing a BCCI fitness test, is set to continue as T20 captain, potentially through to the 2026 T20 World Cup.The Gill dilemma: Despite Shubman Gill’s stellar IPL-2025 (650 runs, avg 50, strike-rate 155.87 as Gujarat Titans skipper), selectors are likely to exclude him from the Asia Cup squad. The focus is likely to be on boundary-hitting prowess. Samson, Abhishek to open? Sanju Samson (three T20I hundreds last year) and Abhishek Sharma (explosive 135 vs England earlier this year) are seen as firstchoice openers. Tilak Varma at No. 3: Despite an average IPL, Varma’s two T20I hundreds in South Africa guarantee his spot, highlighting the priority of international form over IPL stats. Jaiswal as third opener? Yashasvi Jaiswal is touted to be the preferred third opener over Gill, primarily due to his hitting abilities in the Powerplay. What happens to Shreyas Iyer? Shreyas Iyer, despite a strong IPL (captaining Punjab Kings to the final) and top-scoring in the 2025 Champions Trophy (243 runs), faces stiff competition from left-handed big-hitters like Shivam Dube and Rinku Singh.Bumrah good to go: The ace pacer has confirmed his availability. Meanwhile, Mohammed Siraj has been rested. Expect Arshdeep Singh, Prasidh Krishna (IPL Purple Cap with 25 wickets) and Harshit Rana to fill the quota of fast bowlers in the squad. Spin arsenal: Varun Chakravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Washington Sundar and Axar Patel are locked in for the pitches in UAE, blending attack and allround abilities. Jitesh in the fray: Jitesh Sharma, IPL champion with RCB, is likely to get the nod as backup ’keeper due to his finishing skills. RECENT INDIA T20 SQUADS vs England: Suryakumar Yadav (c), Rinku Singh, Sanju Samson (wk), Dhruv Jurel (wk), Axar Patel (vc), Abhishek Sharma, Hardik Pandya, Tilak Varma, Washington Sundar, Nitish Kumar Reddy, Arshdeep Singh, Harshit Rana, Mohammed Shami, Ravi Bishnoi, Varun Chakravarthy. In 2024 T20 World Cup: Rohit Sharma (c), Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant (wk), Sanju Samson (wk), Hardik Pandya (vc), Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Over the years, as a sports journalist, Hindol has covered important events like the 2012 London Olympics, 2008 Beijing Olympics, 2010 Commonwealth Games and the 2011 Cricket World Cup. Hindol has had a diverse profile having worked in all forms of media - TV, Radio, New Media and Print. Exclusive | 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill' - Harbhajan Singh
With the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy.
EXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsEXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too'TrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliJaved MiandadKedar JadhavR AshwinEXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh: 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill, he can dominate T20Is too'Amit Kumar / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 18, 2025, 15:41 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWith the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy. India's player of the series India's captain Shubman Gill on day five of the fifth cricket test match between England and India at The Kia Oval in London, Monday, Aug. 4, 2025. (AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth) NEW DELHI: The Asia Cup 2025 India squad is set to be announced, and the burning question is whether Test captain Shubman Gill will find a place in the team. With India’s T20I batting lineup already packed with hard-hitters like Abhishek Sharma, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, Tilak Varma, captain Suryakumar Yadav, and Hardik Pandya, the selectors face a “sweet headache” when it comes to Gill’s inclusion.India’s top six T20I batters boast impressive strike rates: Abhishek Sharma (193.84), Suryakumar Yadav (167.07), Yashasvi Jaiswal (164.31), Hardik Pandya (141.67), Tilak Varma (155.07), and Sanju Samson (152.38).Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!In comparison, Gill has played 21 T20Is so far, with a strike rate of 139.27.So, will the selectors still back Shubman?Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh, who has closely observed Gill, strongly believes the youngster deserves a place in the squad.“In the T20 format, it’s important to understand that it’s not just about big hitting. If Shubman decides to attack, he can match anyone, because he is a very solid player with strong basics. A batter with such a strong foundation can score runs in any format," Harbhajan told TimesofIndia.com in an exclusive interview."If you look at the IPL, Shubman has scored runs every season. He has worn the Orange Cap — and that doesn’t happen by chance. And it’s not like he bats only at a strike rate of 120 or 130; he can also bat at a strike rate of 160," he added."Yes, we do have players like Abhishek Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav, and Tilak Varma, but you cannot undermine or underestimate Shubman Gill. He is a very talented batter who can adapt to any format. He is an all-format player. In my opinion, he can play T20s and even dominate the format. We as fans are used to seeing fours and sixes every ball, but you also need batters who can play long innings and rescue the team when required,” Harbhajan said.When asked to name his 15 for the Asia Cup, which is set to be picked on Tuesday, Harbhajan replied: "I think the squad should be: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhishek Sharma, Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav – the captain, Hardik Pandya, Shreyas Iyer, Washington Sundar, Riyan Parag for the middle order, Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh, KL Rahul, Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant.”'CRICKET NEVER STOPS FOR ANYONE'The Asia Cup will mark India’s first major multi-team tournament without stalwarts Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The duo featured in India’s previous two global triumphs — the ICC T20 World Cup 2024 and the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 — both won under Rohit’s leadership.This, as Harbhajan puts it, is the beginning of a new era.“See, cricket never stops for anyone. Whether we talk about the time of Sunil Gavaskar, Kapil Dev, or Sachin Tendulkar, the game has always gone on. Someone or the other comes in and takes the team forward. Right now, the way Shubman Gill and his team-mates have played in England… Rohit and Virat have left their legacy in the right hands. We have seen the shift happen smoothly. It will be a big tournament that will be played without Virat and Rohit," Harbhajan said.PollShould Shubman Gill be included in the Asia Cup 2025 squad?Yes, he deserves a spotNo, we have better options"The way these youngsters have taken responsibility… I believe this is the natural rule of life — change is inevitable. If there is no change, things become stagnant. Moving forward is always good. And the way Shubman Gill and his team-mates have performed, it’s really pleasing to see."Of course, we have seen this shift earlier as well. When the big players move on, someone else steps up, takes responsibility, and carries the team forward. As long as the team keeps moving in the right direction, that is the main goal. The way Gill and his team have played in England, Rohit and Virat have definitely left their legacy in safe hands,” he added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Swiatek beats Paolini to clinch WTA Cincinnati Open title
Iga Swiatek secured her first Cincinnati Open title, defeating Jasmine Paolini in straight sets. The victory, Swiatek's 11th WTA 1000 title, brings her closer to Serena Williams' record and boosts her confidence heading into the US Open. This win also puts her within striking distance of the WTA number one ranking currently held by Aryna Sabalenka.
Iga Swiatek beats Jasmine Paolini to clinch WTA Cincinnati Open title | Tennis News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsTennisCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMABadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePapertennisUS Open 2024Australian Open 2025French Open 2025Wimbledon 2024Tennis VideosNewsSports NewsTennis NewsTop Stories NewsTennis NewsIga Swiatek beats Jasmine Paolini to clinch WTA Cincinnati Open titleTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekVirat KohliCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyR AshwinIga Swiatek beats Jasmine Paolini to clinch WTA Cincinnati Open titleAFP /  Aug 19, 2025, 07:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIga Swiatek secured her first Cincinnati Open title, defeating Jasmine Paolini in straight sets. The victory, Swiatek's 11th WTA 1000 title, brings her closer to Serena Williams' record and boosts her confidence heading into the US Open. This win also puts her within striking distance of the WTA number one ranking currently held by Aryna Sabalenka. Iga Swiatek Iga Swiatek filled in a piece of her career tennis puzzle on Monday as she won the ATP-WTA Cincinnati Open for the first time with a 7-5, 6-4 defeat of Jasmine Paolini. The final lasting for just under two hours featured 16 break-point chances, with the Polish winner converting on six of 10 while Paolini struggled to make the most of her break opportunities.The six-time Grand Slam singles champion's 11th career win at the WTA 1000 level has left her within striking distance of the all-time record of 13 titles held by Serena Williams. Swiatek won the Cincinnati without dropping a set.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The 24-year-old backed up her breakthrough Wimbledon trophy with the Midwest honours and now heads to the last Grand Slam of the season at the US Open with a major confidence boost after the 24th title of her career.Swiatek also climbed to within 500 points of current WTA number one Aryna Sabalenka, with the lead at the top of the table likely to be in play at the Open when it begins on Sunday.Swiatek had stalled twice at the last two editions at the semi-final stage and now has only the Canadian tournament where she has not reached the final at a 1000 event.Swiatek began on the wrong foot as she lost serve to trail 0-3. But the situation was only temporary as the former number one immediately began her turnaround.The Pole answered immediately with two breaks of serve and moved to a 5-3 leadBut Paolini earned another break in the 10th game, saving a Swiatek set point to square the final at five-all.Paolini dropped serve for 5-6, giving her opponent the chance to produce a love game and claim the opener 7-5 after just under an hour on court.The second set was a roller coaster, with the pair twice swapping breaks of serve before Swiatek salvaged a pair of break points to lead 5-3 and then serving out the winner two games later.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. India Asia Cup 2025 Squad: When will it be announced? Date, timing, venue confirmed
The BCCI is set to announce India's 15-member squad for the ACC Men’s Asia Cup 2025 on August 19, following a selection meeting in Mumbai. Suryakumar Yadav is expected to lead the team, with key T20 performers likely to be favored. Jasprit Bumrah returns, while India prepares for matches against UAE and Pakistan in the UAE-based tournament.
India Asia Cup Squad: When will the 15-member side be announced? Date, time, venue confirmed | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIndia Asia Cup Squad: When will the 15-member side be announced? Date, time, venue confirmedTrendingKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaKagiso RabadaAUS vs SA Live ScoreSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementIga SwiatekWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementCarlos AlcarazVarun ChakravarthyRohit SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad: When will the 15-member side be announced? Date, time, venue confirmedTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 10:22 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe BCCI is set to announce India's 15-member squad for the ACC Men’s Asia Cup 2025 on August 19, following a selection meeting in Mumbai. Suryakumar Yadav is expected to lead the team, with key T20 performers likely to be favored. Jasprit Bumrah returns, while India prepares for matches against UAE and Pakistan in the UAE-based tournament.  Jasprit Bumrah, Surya Kumar Yadav, and Shubman Gill (Agency Photos)  The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) will unveil its 15-member squad for the ACC Men’s Asia Cup 2025 on Tuesday, following a high-profile selection meeting in Mumbai. The Senior Men’s Selection Committee will gather at the BCCI headquarters, with the squad announcement scheduled for 1:30 PM (IST) on the 4th floor of the BCCI HQ.EXCLUSIVE: India to boycott Pakistan in Asia Cup? Harbhajan Singh says, 'Khoon aur paani ek saath nahi beh sakte'The press conference will be attended by India’s T20 captain and the chairman of selectors.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The Asia Cup, to be played in the T20 format in the UAE from September 9 to 28, comes just a year after India lifted the 2024 T20 World Cup. Naturally, the spotlight is on continuity and trust in the young T20 specialists who powered India’s success.Suryakumar Yadav is expected to continue as captain, having cleared his fitness test at the BCCI’s Centre of Excellence.India Asia Cup squad selection LIVEDate: August 19Time: 1:30pm ISTVenue: BCCI Headquarters, MumbaiLIVE: TimesofIndia.com, JioHotstarAs reported by TOI, star opener Shubman Gill, despite stellar Test and IPL performances, may find it difficult to break into the T20 side. With Sanju Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma delivering consistently in the shortest format, the management is keen to back them. TOI understands that Gill remains in the selectors’ long-term plans, but not as a frontline T20 option.On the bowling front, Jasprit Bumrah is set to return after overcoming a minor knee concern, while Mohammed Siraj could be rested following a heavy workload in England. Arshdeep Singh, Hardik Pandya, and Prasidh Krishna are likely seam-bowling options, with spinners Kuldeep Yadav, Varun Chakravarthy, and Washington Sundar in contention for the UAE’s slow pitches.India are grouped with Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in the Asia Cup. They will open their campaign against UAE on September 10 in Dubai, before the much-anticipated clash against Pakistan on September 14. The women’s selection meeting will also take place later in the day, at 3:30 PM, to finalise India’s squad for the ODI series against Australia and the ICC Women’s World Cup.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous'Coolie' actress Rachita Ram's most gorgeous picturesEntertainmentPreity Mukhundhan radiates eleganceEntertainmentNeha Harsora’s dazzling and dreamy ethnic lookstvBigg Boss Malayalam 7: Stunning weekend looks of the contestantstvFun facts about the Param Sundari actor Sidharth MalhotraEntertainment8 simple habits that will help reduce stress on the eyes and improve vision naturallyLifestyle8 times Samantha Ruth Prabhu turned perfect muse for Krésha BajajLifestyleSaree tales by actress Nisha RavikrishnantvManasi Parekh Serves Style & SmilesEntertainment10 celebrity-inspired Indian baby boy namesLifestyle Next123Top Sports NewsIndia Asia Cup SquadWomen ODI WC Squad AnnouncementVirat KohliJasprit BumrahSaaniya ChandhokSunil GavaskarTop TrendingPatrick MahomesAntonio BrownRaheem MorrisJoy TaylorTravis Hunters WifeOlivia Paige DunneMartina NavratilovaMarco BelinelliPatrick MahomesTravis KelceTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn SportsEntire WebsiteIndia Asia Cup squad announcement Live: Selectors face tough callBIG MISS FOR SOUTH AFRICA! Top 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is why
The 2025 T20 Asia Cup will see India and Pakistan without key players. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have retired. Pakistan dropped Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Salman Ali Agha will lead Pakistan in a preparatory series. Pakistan faces India, UAE, and Oman in Group A. India's squad is still awaited. The Asia Cup concludes on September 28.
Top 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is why | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsTop 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is whyTrendingSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinSuryakumar YadavSaaniya ChandhokMS DhoniShahid AfridiIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementGautam GambhirVirat KohliCincinnati Open Final Live StreamingKedar JadhavR AshwinTop 2 T20I run-scorers for both India and Pakistan won't be part of Asia Cup 2025 - here is whyTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 18, 2025, 19:40 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe 2025 T20 Asia Cup will see India and Pakistan without key players. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have retired. Pakistan dropped Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Salman Ali Agha will lead Pakistan in a preparatory series. Pakistan faces India, UAE, and Oman in Group A. India's squad is still awaited. The Asia Cup concludes on September 28. Mohammad Rizwan, Babar Azam, Virat Kohli, and Rohit Sharma (Agency Photos)  The 2025 T20 Asia Cup will be unlike any other, with the top two run-scorers for both India and Pakistan set to miss the tournament. For India, Rohit Sharma (4,231 runs) and Virat Kohli (4,188 runs) have already retired from T20 internationals, while Pakistan’s selectors made the bold call to omit Babar Azam (4,223 runs) and Mohammad Rizwan (3,414 runs) from their 17-member squad announced on Sunday.Pakistan, led by Salman Ali Agha, will play a preparatory tri-series against Afghanistan and UAE in Sharjah from August 29 to September 7 before the Asia Cup begins in the Emirates on September 9. The team management’s decision to leave out two of Pakistan’s most successful modern-day batters has sparked major debate, given that Babar and Rizwan were central to Pakistan’s famous 10-wicket win over India in the 2021 T20 World Cup. EXCLUSIVE | Harbhajan Singh on Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Shubman Gill, India vs Pakistan and moreGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Their last T20I appearances came in December 2024.Chief selector Aaqib Javed backed the new-look squad, stressing confidence in their ability to challenge India. “This team has the ability to beat India in the Asia Cup. Every player understands the magnitude of an India-Pakistan clash, but we don’t need to add extra pressure,” he said.Head coach Mike Hesson explained the decision regarding Babar, pointing out areas for improvement. “Babar has been asked to work on his strike rate and handling spin. He’s too good a player not to consider in the future, and playing in leagues like the BBL could help him showcase those improvements,” Hesson noted.PollHow do you feel about Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan being omitted from the Pakistan squad for the Asia Cup?It's a bold decision that could pay offIt's a mistake; they are vital playersI need more information before decidingI'm indifferent to the changesDespite recent series defeats to Bangladesh and West Indies, Pakistan remain optimistic. Hesson highlighted Sahibzada Farhan’s emergence, noting his three Player-of-the-Match awards in just six games as a sign of promise.Pakistan will face India, UAE, and Oman in Group A of the eight-team Asia Cup, which concludes on September 28. India’s squad is yet to be announced, adding intrigue to one of cricket’s most anticipated rivalries.Pakistan squad: Salman Ali Agha (c), Abrar Ahmed, Faheem Ashraf, Fakhar Zaman, Haris Rauf, Hasan Ali, Hasan Nawaz, Hussain Talat, Khushdil Shah, Mohammad Haris (wk), Mohammad Nawaz, Mohammad Waseem Jr, Sahibzada Farhan, Saim Ayub, Salman Mirza, Shaheen Shah Afridi, Sufyan Moqim. India squad: Yet to be announcedCatch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.
