Oklahoma requires teachers from California and New York to pass conservative loyalty test: Here's why critics call it 'MAGA indoctrination'
Oklahoma will require teachers from California and New York to pass a PragerU-administered exam aimed at preventing “radical leftist ideology” in classrooms. The test has drawn criticism from teachers’ unions and politicians, who label it a "MAGA loyalty test" and political posturing amid a teacher shortage. The assessment focuses on conservative principles and is set to become a mandatory part of teacher certification in the state, as reported by the Associated Press.
Oklahoma requires teachers from California and New York to pass conservative loyalty test: Here's why critics call it 'MAGA indoctrination' - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsOklahoma requires teachers from California and New York to pass conservative loyalty test: Here's why critics call it 'MAGA indoctrination'Oklahoma requires teachers from California and New York to pass conservative loyalty test: Here's why critics call it 'MAGA indoctrination'Sanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 19, 2025, 06:44 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeOklahoma will require teachers from California and New York to pass a PragerU-administered exam aimed at preventing “radical leftist ideology” in classrooms. The test has drawn criticism from teachers’ unions and politicians, who label it a "MAGA loyalty test" and political posturing amid a teacher shortage. The assessment focuses on conservative principles and is set to become a mandatory part of teacher certification in the state, as reported by the Associated Press. Oklahoma’s new PragerU teacher exam sparks criticism over ‘MAGA loyalty test’ claims. (AI Image) Oklahoma will require teachers applying from California and New York to pass a new assessment designed to prevent the spread of what state officials describe as "radical leftist ideology." The Republican-controlled state’s education department announced that prospective teachers from these two blue states must clear a certification exam before gaining permission to teach in Oklahoma schools.The exam, administered by PragerU, a conservative nonprofit based in Oklahoma, forms part of the state’s effort to control the political content taught in classrooms. Opponents of the measure, however, have labelled the test a "MAGA loyalty test" aimed at imposing partisan viewpoints on educators, according to the Associated Press.What the test involves and who administers itRyan Walters, Oklahoma’s superintendent of public schools, stated on Monday that "as long as I am superintendent, Oklahoma classrooms will be safeguarded from the radical leftist ideology fostered in places like California and New York," as reported by the Associated Press. The test was developed in partnership with PragerU, an organisation known for producing short videos promoting conservative perspectives on politics and economics.The state has not publicly released the entire 50-question exam, but the Associated Press obtained the first five questions. These include inquiries about the first three words of the US Constitution and the importance of freedom of religion to America’s identity. Marissa Streit, CEO of PragerU, told CNN that several questions aim to address "undoing the damage of gender ideology," as quoted by the Associated Press.PragerU's role institutionalised in OklahomaQuinton Hitchcock, spokesperson for Oklahoma’s education department, said the assessment will be introduced "very soon." Experts note this marks a significant shift, with PragerU moving from an optional educational resource to an institutionalised gatekeeper for teacher certification in the state.Jonathan Zimmerman, a history of education professor at the University of Pennsylvania, called the move a "watershed moment," explaining that PragerU’s involvement in certification represents a formal endorsement of its materials. He noted that many teachers rely on online resources rather than textbooks for instruction, with PragerU now playing an official role in that process, as reported by the Associated Press.Criticism from teachers’ unions and politiciansThe American Federation of Teachers (AFT), one of the largest teachers’ unions in the US, criticised the requirement. AFT President Randi Weingarten described it as a "MAGA loyalty test" that would deter teachers in a state already facing a significant shortage, according to the Associated Press.State Democratic Party chairman John Waldron condemned the policy as "political posturing." Waldron, who moved from New Jersey to Oklahoma to teach social studies, said such tests would signal the state’s lack of seriousness in attracting quality educators and called it "a textbook definition of indoctrination," as quoted by the Associated Press.Walters has also pushed to revise Oklahoma’s curriculum standards to include conspiracy theories about the 2020 presidential election, a move criticised by Weingarten as prioritising political gain over education.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Since joining TOI in 2006, he has played a pivotal role in expanding the platform’s digital presence and spearheading major education events. Previously, Sanjay held leadership positions in sports journalism, covering high-profile events such as the Cricket World Cup and Olympics. He holds a PG Diploma in Journalism from Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan and is proficient in various content management systems.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousPreity Back-to-school season is here: How parents can help kids get back into routine
As the back-to-school season begins, families face the challenge of resetting routines after summer. Experts stress the importance of sleep, consistent schedules, and student involvement in building healthy habits. Addressing first-day jitters and easing anxieties helps children feel prepared and confident. Ultimately, structured routines not only boost learning but also bring calm and balance to busy households.
Back-to-school season is here: How parents can help kids get back into routine - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsBack-to-school season is here: How parents can help kids get back into routineBack-to-school season is here: How parents can help kids get back into routineApeksha Tanwar / TOI Education /  Aug 19, 2025, 06:21 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAs the back-to-school season begins, families face the challenge of resetting routines after summer. Experts stress the importance of sleep, consistent schedules, and student involvement in building healthy habits. Addressing first-day jitters and easing anxieties helps children feel prepared and confident. Ultimately, structured routines not only boost learning but also bring calm and balance to busy households.  After weeks of late nights, movie marathons, and unstructured summer days, the first week of school can feel like a jolt — not just for students, but for parents too. Across the country, some classrooms have already opened their doors while others are about to, marking the return of the back-to-school season in full swing.The key to easing this transition lies in resetting routines early, from bedtime to morning schedules, so children walk into classrooms feeling ready to learn. Beyond academics, these daily rhythms give children a sense of security, reduce stress, and make the entire household run more smoothly. For families, it’s less about strict rules and more about building habits that stick.Here’s how parents and students can work together to ease back into routine without the usual chaos.Why sleep is the foundation of learningSleep, unsurprisingly, tops the list. Research has long shown that a good night’s rest directly impacts focus, memory, and classroom performance. “We don’t say ‘get good sleep’ just because,” pediatrician Dr. Gabrina Dixon told the Associated Press. “It really helps kids learn and it helps them function throughout the day.” The right amount varies by age — preschoolers may need up to 13 hours, tweens nine to 12, and teenagers eight to 10.The takeaway? Sleep is not just rest, it’s fuel. Students who start the school year with consistent sleep patterns are more alert in class, and teachers find they are easier to engage.Building consistency beyond bedtimeBut routines aren’t just about sleep. Parents who create small, predictable rituals in the weeks before school — setting consistent wake-up times, practicing quicker morning checklists, and even limiting screen use at night — often find the school-day transition smoother. Dr. Nitun Verma of the American Academy of Sleep Medicine explained to the Associated Press that winding down with simple, calming activities like reading or showering helps children “slowly let go of the gas pedal” before bed.These small changes may feel minor, but they add up. Students who ease into the rhythm before school starts show up less anxious and better prepared for the demands of a new academic year.Let kids play a role in their routineFamilies also discover that kids themselves play a role in shaping routines. Author Nikkya Hargrove shared with the Associated Press how her 10-year-old twins negotiate for extra reading time before lights out. Some mornings, they regret staying up too late, but she sees that as part of the learning process. “If they’re groggy and they don’t like how they feel, then they know, ‘OK, I have to go to bed earlier,’” she said.Giving students ownership, even in small ways, builds responsibility. When routines feel collaborative rather than enforced, children are more likely to stick to them — and more likely to carry those habits into the classroom.Tackling first-day jittersThe other piece of the puzzle is managing first-day jitters. Experts say back-to-school anxiety can keep children wide awake, no matter how early the bedtime. Dixon advises parents to talk openly with kids about what worries them — whether it’s walking into a new classroom, meeting teachers, or making friends. Test runs, like visiting the school or attending open houses, can make the unfamiliar feel less intimidating.Addressing anxieties head-on helps students approach the first day with confidence. Teachers, too, benefit when students arrive more relaxed and ready to connect — setting the tone for a smoother year ahead.Parents are adjusting tooAnd if things don’t go perfectly? That’s normal. Parents, too, are adjusting to new schedules after summer’s flexibility. As Dixon told the Associated Press, “I always say, ‘Take a deep breath, it’ll be OK.’ And just start that schedule.” Ultimately, the goal isn’t perfection on day one — it’s progress over time. A steady rhythm not only helps children learn better but also brings calm to busy households navigating the back-to-school rush. In the long run, these everyday routines can be just as important as test scores or homework in shaping a child’s success.And the best part? Every new school year offers families a fresh chance to reset, reconnect, and build habits that will carry students through not just the months ahead, but well beyond the classroom.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousPreity Mukhundhan radiates eleganceEntertainmentNeha Harsora’s dazzling and dreamy ethnic lookstvBigg Boss Thama teaser: Ayushmann-Rashmika’s ‘bloody’ love story
Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna star in the upcoming romantic horror-comedy, ‘Thama,’ alongside Paresh Rawal and Nawazuddin Siddiqui. The teaser reveals a twisted love story set in a fictional world, sparking curiosity with suspense, thrill, and romance. Set to release this Diwali, ‘Thama’ promises a 'bloody' love story, generating excitement among fans.
'Thama' teaser: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna’s ‘bloody’ love story promises thrills; netizens predict the horror-comedy will be 'epic' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Thama' teaser: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna’s ‘bloody’ love story promises thrills; netizens predict the horror-comedy will be 'epic'TrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan Thoogudeepa'Thama' teaser: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna’s ‘bloody’ love story promises thrills; netizens predict the horror-comedy will be 'epic'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 12:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAyushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna star in the upcoming romantic horror-comedy, ‘Thama,’ alongside Paresh Rawal and Nawazuddin Siddiqui. The teaser reveals a twisted love story set in a fictional world, sparking curiosity with suspense, thrill, and romance. Set to release this Diwali, ‘Thama’ promises a 'bloody' love story, generating excitement among fans.  Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna are back with an unusual romantic horror-comedy, ‘Thama’. The film also stars Paresh Rawal and Nawazuddin Siddiqui. Today, the makers released the first teaser on social media, giving fans their first glimpse of this twisted love story.In the film, Ayushmann plays Alok, Rashmika is Tadaka, Nawazuddin takes on Yakshasan, and Paresh portrays Ram Bajaj Goyal. Faisal Malik and Geeta Agrawal also join the ensemble, completing a star-studded cast.Tahira Kashyap Was Broke After Marrying Ayushmann Khurrana? Her Emotional Confession Shocks Fans!The teaser opens with a mysterious dialogueThe teaser starts with Ayushmann’s voiceover, “Reh paogi mere bina, sau saalon tak?” Rashmika replies, “Sau saal kya, ek pal bhi ke liye bhi nahi.” These lines instantly create curiosity about the story. Set in a fictional world, the teaser leaves viewers wondering who the vampire is. With hints of suspense, thrill, and romance, it promises a ‘bloody’ love story unlike anything seen before.Makers tease romantic horrorThe makers shared the teaser on social media with the caption, “Na darr kabhi itna shaktishaali tha, aur na pyaar kabhi itna BLOODY! Brace yourself this Diwali to witness the first love story in the Maddock Horror-Comedy Universe. Step into the World of Thama, a cinematic experience unlike anything you’ve seen before, storming into cinemas worldwide. #Thama Teaser Out Now!” This clearly sets the tone, a thrilling, bloody love story with mystery and suspense.Netizens reactThe teaser of ‘Thama’ has already caught the imagination of fans and netizens alike. One viewer wrote, “thama teaser is impressive. the horror universe is doing what the spy universe never could” Another added, “#Thama LOOKS EPIC! 🔥🔥….This might just be the blockbuster #AyushmannKhurrana has been waiting for! With #DIWALI around the corner, the timing” A third fan said, “#THAMA LOOKS IMPRESSIVE! 🔥🔥 The teaser (World of Thama) promises a THRILLING ride in cinemas…This can be #AyushmannKhurrana’s MUCH-NEEDED blockbuster. #DIWALI period is like icing on the cake. #RashmikaMandanna” One more noted, “The teaser was cut smartly without revealing the plot, which worked well. The teaser gave a good sense of #Thama’s world, though I felt a mix of excitement and concern. While some parts impressed, the CGI and VFX still require refinement. Overall, enjoyable teaser.” Diwali release for the film‘Thama’ is set to release worldwide this Diwali. Before that, the teaser will appear on the big screen during ‘Param Sundari’ on 29 August."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. Coolie: 2nd biggest Indian film in North America
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' is making waves at the North American box office, grossing USD 6.22 million in five days, nearing 'Chhaava's' total earnings. Despite mixed word-of-mouth and dipping daily collections, 'Coolie' showcases Rajinikanth's star power and the global appeal of Tamil cinema. In India, 'Coolie' faces collection drops, while 'Chhaava's' success highlights the diverse genres thriving abroad.
Rajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ becomes the second-biggest Indian film of 2025 in North America with USD 6.22 million in just 5 days | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-officeRajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ becomes the second-biggest Indian film of 2025 in North America with USD 6.22 million in just 5 daysTrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaRajinikanth’s ‘Coolie’ becomes the second-biggest Indian film of 2025 in North America with USD 6.22 million in just 5 daysTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie' is making waves at the North American box office, grossing USD 6.22 million in five days, nearing 'Chhaava's' total earnings. Despite mixed word-of-mouth and dipping daily collections, 'Coolie' showcases Rajinikanth's star power and the global appeal of Tamil cinema. In India, 'Coolie' faces collection drops, while 'Chhaava's' success highlights the diverse genres thriving abroad. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' is making waves at the North American box office, grossing USD 6.22 million in five days, nearing 'Chhaava's' total earnings. Despite mixed word-of-mouth and dipping daily collections, 'Coolie' showcases Rajinikanth's star power and the global appeal of Tamil cinema. In India, 'Coolie' faces collection drops, while 'Chhaava's' success highlights the diverse genres thriving abroad. Superstar Rajinikanth has once again proven his unmatched global appeal with his latest release Coolie, which has stormed the North American box office. The film has grossed an impressive USD 6.22 million in just five days, making it the second-biggest Indian film of 2025 in the region, second only to Chhaava.What makes this feat extraordinary is the pace at which Coolie has scaled these heights. While Chhaava, starring Vicky Kaushal, Rashmika Mandanna, and Akshaye Khanna, earned USD 6.4 million over its entire theatrical run, Coolie has nearly touched that figure within its first 5 days and now needs another USD 200K to breach that amount. While the film earned over USD 3 million just from its premiere shows, the word of mouth on the film isn't exactly great and hence its daily collections are dipping. It now all depends on the coming weekend if the film picks up again or not. The break-even point for the film has been pegged at USD 7.5 million which is still far away as the initial buzz and excitement for the film is over.‘Coolie’ release sparks madness: Rajinikanth fans dance and flood theatres in Tamil NaduIn India as well Coolie has been seeing a drop in it’s collection as in 5 days the film has collected a little over Rs 206 crore. The number in isolation looks big but given the star power attached to the film from Lokesh Kanagaraj to Nagarjuna to Upendra to Shruti Haasan to Aamir Khan, the number does not justify the scale. Chhaava, directed by Laxman Utekar, had been considered one of the surprise North American success stories of 2025. Its lifetime earnings of USD 6.4 million had set a benchmark for Bollywood films this year. While Coolie is now on the verge of overtaking that tally in less than a week underlines Rajinikanth’s unparalleled star power and the widening scope of Tamil blockbusters overseas but it will be a while before the film starts making profits for its distributors..Interestingly, the competition between Coolie and Chhaava also highlights how diverse genres of Indian cinema are thriving abroad. While Chhaava rode on historical grandeur and star-studded performances, Coolie has gone the other way delivering raw, massy entertainment that appeals directly to audiences looking for high-octane thrills on the big screen."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousTaarak Mehta’s Sunayana Fozdar’s top Inside Ameesha Patel’s luxurious Mumbai home: PICS
Ameesha Patel recently showcased her South Mumbai home on Farah Khan's YouTube channel. The episode offered a glimpse into her personal space. It highlighted her luxury bag and shoe collection. She also prepared red chicken Thai curry, sharing memories from her 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai' shoot. Her home features art, French windows, and personal touches.
Inside Ameesha Patel’s luxurious Mumbai home: Warm interiors, sun-lit balcony, 400 designer bags and rare MF Hussain paintings | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodInside Ameesha Patel’s luxurious Mumbai home: Warm interiors, sun-lit balcony, 400 designer bags and rare MF Hussain paintingsTrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaInside Ameesha Patel’s luxurious Mumbai home: Warm interiors, sun-lit balcony, 400 designer bags and rare MF Hussain paintingsTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:27 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAmeesha Patel recently showcased her South Mumbai home on Farah Khan's YouTube channel. The episode offered a glimpse into her personal space. It highlighted her luxury bag and shoe collection. She also prepared red chicken Thai curry, sharing memories from her 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai' shoot. Her home features art, French windows, and personal touches.  Ameesha Patel made her Bollywood debut in 2000 with the film 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai'. She is best known for films like 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha' (2001), 'Humraaz' (2002), 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' (2007), 'Race 2' (2013), and 'Gadar 2' (2023). She recently opened the doors to her South Mumbai home in an episode of Farah Khan’s YouTube show. The episode, shared on Monday, August 18, gave fans a rare peek into Ameesha’s personal space, including her famous collection of luxury bags and shoes. She also cooked red chicken Thai curry, recalling her time in Thailand during the shooting of 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai'.Ameesha Patel Returns: Casual Look, Classic Charm In JuhuA home designed with style and comfortAmeesha’s home, designed by herself, blends luxury with comfort and as she mentions it showcases her ‘South Bombay’ taste. Farah Khan showcased the entrance, decorated with charming wall arts and nameplates reading ‘Amypoo’ and ‘Star’.The living space is warm and inviting, featuring a dining area with stunning art pieces, the area has wooden flooring and floor-to-ceiling French windows that open onto the balcony that lets in sunlight and offers a view of greenery along with a relaxing seating area.Neutral tones decorate the furniture, while large portraits of Ameesha adorn the walls. A mantle displays personal tokens and family pictures. There’s even a dedicated space for rare MF Hussain paintings depicting major religions from around the world.The house also has a cosy entertainment room for friends, and after doing 'Gadar', she also framed a shot of herself with Sunny Deol from the film.The luxury bag and shoe collectionAmeesha’s fashion sense is on full display with her multiple almirahs filled with limited-edition bags and luxury shoes. From Dior and Bottega Veneta to Birkin and YSL totes, her collection is vast. She revealed that she keeps a list of every bag she owns on the cupboard doors, which adds up to around ‘300-400’ pieces.Cooking memories: Red chicken Thai curryAmeesha’s kitchen is modular, sleek, and stylish. During the tour, Ameesha, Farah, and Dilip cooked red chicken Thai curry together. Ameesha reminisced about eating this dish every night while shooting 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai' in Thailand, adding a personal and delicious touch.On the work front, Ameesha’s last hit film was 'Gadar 2', released in 2023. This period action drama, directed by Anil Sharma, also starred Sunny Deol and Utkarsh Sharma. It was a sequel to the iconic 2001 film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous'Coolie' actress Rachita Ram's most Mahavatar Narsimha emerges as 6th biggest Hindi hit of 2025
Ashwin Kumar's mythological epic, 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' has become a box office success, grossing ₹161.1 crore in 25 days. It's now the sixth highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025 and may surpass Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par.' Despite facing competition, the film's strong performance, driven by positive word-of-mouth and cultural resonance, highlights the power of content-driven storytelling in Bollywood.

It's now the sixth highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025 and may surpass Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par.' Despite facing competition, the film's strong performance, driven by positive word-of-mouth and cultural resonance, highlights the power of content-driven storytelling in Bollywood. Ashwin Kumar's mythological epic, 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' has become a box office success, grossing ₹161.1 crore in 25 days. It's now the sixth highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025 and may surpass Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par.' Despite facing competition, the film's strong performance, driven by positive word-of-mouth and cultural resonance, highlights the power of content-driven storytelling in Bollywood. Ashwin Kumar’s mythological epic Mahavatar Narsimha has scripted a remarkable success story at the Hindi box office. After a steady 25-day run, the film has collected Rs 161.1 crore net, officially making it the sixth highest-grossing Hindi film of 2025 so far. What’s more, with Aamir Khan’s Sitaare Zameen Par standing just ahead at Rs 166.18 crore, trade believes Mahavatar Narsimha could well challenge for the fifth spot by the coming weekend as the animation film was able to survive the clash between Rajinikanth’s Coolie and Hrithik Roshan-Jr NTR’s War 2 and both films are now losing audience with each passing day.The year 2025 has been crowded with big-ticket Hindi releases, ranging from historical dramas to comedies and sequels. The top five at the moment include Chhaava (Rs 585.7 crore), Saiyaara (Rs 324.67 crore), Housefull 5 (Rs 183.88 crore), Raid 2 (Rs 173.44 crore), and Sitaare Zameen Par (Rs 166.18 crore). For Mahavatar Narsimha a film without an A-list star headlining it breaking into this list is a feat in itself.The film opened modestly with Rs 1.35 crore on Day 1in Hindi, but its collections grew quickly as positive word-of-mouth spread and it ended week 1 on Rs 32.45 crore. By Week 2 the film added another Rs 54.95 crore to its kitty. During Week 3 the collections remained steady as it added another Rs 53.75 crore to its tally and during the fourth weekend it minted Rs 18.45 crore. On Monday the film earned another Rs 1.5 crore, taking the overall Hindi collection of the film to Rs 161.1 crore as per Sacnilk, while the overall collection of the film stands at Rs 212.6 crore Such box office stamina indicates that the film has connected deeply with audiences, particularly in the Hindi heartland, where mythological stories continue to hold immense cultural resonance.At its current total of Rs 161.1 crore, Mahavatar Narsimha is just Rs 5 crore short of overtaking Sitaare Zameen Par. Given its present trend of Rs 1-2 crore weekday earnings and higher weekend jumps, trade believes the crossover could happen within the next few days. If that occurs, Ashwin Kumar’s directorial will climb to the 5th position among 2025’s Hindi blockbusters, displacing an Aamir Khan starrer, no small achievement for a film led by content rather than sheer star power.The film’s success can be attributed to multiple factors. The mythological theme, blending spirituality with cinematic spectacle, has resonated with family audiences. With Rs 161.1 crore already in its kitty, Mahavatar Narsimha has not just surprised trade pundits but also cemented Ashwin Kumar’s place as a filmmaker to watch. The coming weekend will be crucial—if the film overtakes Sitaare Zameen Par, it will rewrite the rankings yet again and prove that content-driven storytelling still has the power to challenge Bollywood’s biggest stars at the box office."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. FAKE Bieber performs at club; gets kicked out - WATCH
A Justin Bieber impersonator, believed to be Dylan Desclos, fooled a Las Vegas nightclub into thinking he was the real singer. He reportedly took to the stage at Wynn Las Vegas, performing Bieber's hits before being discovered. The impersonator was subsequently removed and banned from the venue after DJ Gryffin mistakenly invited him onstage.
Justin Bieber impersonator performs LIVE at Las Vegas nightclub; gets KICKED OUT and banned after organisers realise he was 'fake' - WATCH | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmentenglishhollywoodJustin Bieber impersonator performs LIVE at Las Vegas nightclub; gets KICKED OUT and banned after organisers realise he was 'fake' - WATCHTrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaJustin Bieber impersonator performs LIVE at Las Vegas nightclub; gets KICKED OUT and banned after organisers realise he was 'fake' - WATCHTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:47 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeA Justin Bieber impersonator, believed to be Dylan Desclos, fooled a Las Vegas nightclub into thinking he was the real singer. He reportedly took to the stage at Wynn Las Vegas, performing Bieber's hits before being discovered. The impersonator was subsequently removed and banned from the venue after DJ Gryffin mistakenly invited him onstage.  A Justin Bieber impersonator has gone viral online after managing to fool an entire Las Vegas nightclub that he was the real deal. The man believed to be Dylan Desclos, who promotes himself online as a “Justin Bieber lookalike” has taken social media by storm after he allegedly took over the microphone and rocked the stage at a nightclub, belting out Bieber's biggest hits and had many believing he was the superstar.Behind Bieber’s Smile: Insiders Say His Marriage Is Still In Trouble?The incident reportedly took place on Saturday at Wynn Las Vegas, where the impersonator managed to convince organisers he was the pop star. According to reports from TMZ, he even performed a few songs before staff realised he was a 'fake'.“After an elaborate and multi-step ruse by him and his advance team, a Justin Bieber impersonator was granted access to the XS stage. As soon as the error was recognized, he was removed from the resort and denied future entry,” a representative for Wynn and XS Nightclub said in a statement.DJ Gryffin, who was performing at the club, mistakenly invited the impersonator onstage and even shared a video of the incident on Instagram. Photos doing the rounds online even saw people at the club stopping him to pose for pictures. However, on being caught, the impersonator was reportedly kicked out and has been permanently banned from the nightclub. The real Justin Bieber has not commented on the matter.The incident comes just weeks after the singer hosted a high-profile listening party in Los Angeles for his new album Swag, attended by Hailey Bieber, John Mayer, The Kid Laroi, Madison Beer, and other celebrities."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Saiyaara crosses USD 6 million in North America
Mohit Suri's Saiyaara, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a hit overseas. The romantic drama has crossed USD 6 million in North America. It is now the third highest-grossing Indian film there. Saiyaara added nearly a million dollars in just 13 days. It is the second-highest-grossing Hindi film in North America.
Mohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ crosses USD 6 million in North America, becomes third-biggest Indian film of the year | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-officeMohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ crosses USD 6 million in North America, becomes third-biggest Indian film of the yearTrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaMohit Suri, Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s ‘Saiyaara’ crosses USD 6 million in North America, becomes third-biggest Indian film of the yearTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:28 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMohit Suri's Saiyaara, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a hit overseas. The romantic drama has crossed USD 6 million in North America. It is now the third highest-grossing Indian film there. Saiyaara added nearly a million dollars in just 13 days. It is the second-highest-grossing Hindi film in North America. Mohit Suri's Saiyaara, starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a hit overseas. The romantic drama has crossed USD 6 million in North America. It is now the third highest-grossing Indian film there. Saiyaara added nearly a million dollars in just 13 days. It is the second-highest-grossing Hindi film in North America. Mohit Suri’s Saiyaara, featuring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has emerged as one of the biggest success stories of Indian cinema overseas this year. The romantic drama, which opened to warm word-of-mouth in India and abroad, has now crossed the coveted USD 6 million mark in North America, establishing itself as the third highest-grossing Indian film in the territory.The film, which had already earned USD 5.1 million till 5th August, continued its strong box office momentum in the weeks that followed. On 18th August, Saiyaara officially breached the USD 6 million milestone. That means the film added nearly a million dollars in just 13 days, a feat that underlines its consistent theatrical pull despite intense competition.‘Saiyaara’ breaks lifetime records of ‘War’ and ‘Dunki’ by crossing ₹500 cr worldwide in 18 days.The Rankings GameAmong Indian films in North America, Saiyaara now stands at No. 3, behind two heavyweight performers. At the top is Chhaava the historical epic starring Vicky Kaushal, Rashmika Mandanna, and Akshaye Khanna—which continues to lead with USD 6.4 million. Rajinikanth’s action-packed entertainer Coolie holds the second spot with USD 6.22 million.For Hindi films specifically, Saiyaara’s performance is even more remarkable. It is now the second-highest-grossing Hindi film ever in North America, trailing only Chhaava. Beating the ClashWhat makes Saiyaara’s journey more impressive is how it navigated a tough release window as after a strong run of 4 weeks the film ran into two behemoths Rajinikanth’s Coolie and Hrithik Roshan-Jr NTR’s War 2. While Coolie went on to mint USD 6.22 million in 5 days , War 2 also breached the USD 3 million mark. Yet, just as in the domestic market where it added Rs 1.90 crore in 4 days ( 14th August to 17th August) , Saiyaara managed to carve its own space overseas, proving that strong content and emotional appeal can help films rise above competition.Industry insiders point out that Mohit Suri’s brand of emotionally charged romance combined with a fresh pairing of Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, and a well-curated music album has catapulted the film into everyone’s heart. For Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, Saiyaara’s success is more than just box office numbers; it is a dream launch that has given them instant recognition on the global stage. And for Mohit Suri, it is yet another validation of his storytelling formula that continues to resonate with audiences across continents."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Achyut Potdar passes away: Fans recall his iconic dialogue
Achyut Potdar, famed for his role in '3 Idiots', passed at 91. He acted in over 125 films and 100 TV serials. Potdar was also known for his roles in 'Aakrosh' and 'Parinda'. Hansal Mehta shared a tribute to the actor. His iconic dialogue from '3 Idiots' became a social media sensation.
Achyut Potdar passes away at 91: Hansal Mehta says it was a 'privilege' to work with him; fans recall his iconic ‘Kehna Kya Chahte Ho’ dialogue from ‘3 Idiots’ | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAchyut Potdar passes away at 91: Hansal Mehta says it was a 'privilege' to work with him; fans recall his iconic ‘Kehna Kya Chahte Ho’ dialogue from ‘3 Idiots’TrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAchyut Potdar passes away at 91: Hansal Mehta says it was a 'privilege' to work with him; fans recall his iconic ‘Kehna Kya Chahte Ho’ dialogue from ‘3 Idiots’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 11:21 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAchyut Potdar, famed for his role in '3 Idiots', passed at 91. He acted in over 125 films and 100 TV serials. Potdar was also known for his roles in 'Aakrosh' and 'Parinda'. Hansal Mehta shared a tribute to the actor. His iconic dialogue from '3 Idiots' became a social media sensation.  Veteran actor Achyut Potdar, widely known for his role as a professor in Rajkumar Hirani’s '3 Idiots', passed away on August 18, 2025. He was 91. The actor, who acted in more than 125 Hindi and Marathi films and over 100 TV serials, reportedly breathed his last at Jupiter Hospital in Thane. The cause of his demise has not been disclosed. His final rites are scheduled for August 19, 2025, in Thane.Worked in the Indian Army before filmsAchyut Potdar joined the film and TV industry at the age of 44. Before acting, he had worked in the Indian Armed Forces and the Indian Oil Company. After graduating from college, he became a professor in Rewa, Madhya Pradesh, before joining the Indian Army. Over the years, he became known for his versatility in both films and television.Iconic role in ‘3 Idiots’Achyut Potdar is best remembered for his role as a college professor in '3 Idiots', starring Aamir Khan, Sharman Joshi, and R Madhavan. His famous line, ‘Kehna Kya Chahte Ho’, went viral and became a favourite on social media, inspiring countless memes.Fans and celebs share heartfelt tributesMany fans took to social media to remember him and recalled his iconic line, a fan wrote, “Arrey Kehna Kya Chahte Ho?❗️ Achyut Potdar, 3 Idiots fame, passes away at 91 😢 Om Shanti 🙏”Other fans wrote similar messages on X (formerly Twitter), highlighting the love and admiration they had for the veteran actor.Director Hansal Mehta also shared his tribute, “I was a fan of his character as Jaggu dada’s father. The line ‘Ae Jaggu’ from ‘Angaar’ made me his permanent fan. Was a privilege to have directed him in my directorial debut ‘Jayate’. He played a professional medical witness. Amazing timing and a super caustic sense of humour. Go well Achyut Potdar sir.”Films that showcased his talentOver his long career, Achyut Potdar appeared in films such as: 'Aakrosh', 'Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyoon Aata Hai', 'Ardh Satya', 'Tezaab', 'Parinda', 'Raju Ban Gaya Gentleman', 'Dilwale', 'Yeh Dillagi', 'Rangeela', 'Mritydand', 'Yeshwant', 'Ishq', 'Vaastav', 'Aa Ab Laut Chalen', 'Hum Saath Saath Hain', 'Parineeta', 'Lage Raho Munna Bhai', '3 Idiots', 'Dabangg 2', and 'Ventilator'. These roles made him a familiar face in both Hindi and Marathi cinema.Achyut Potdar’s contribution to Indian cinema and television will be remembered for his natural performances and memorable dialogues. His work connected with audiences across generations, from fans of '3 Idiots' to those who loved his television roles."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Mimicry artist - actor Pala Suresh found dead
Mimicry artist and actor Pala Suresh, known for his impersonations of political figures and roles in films like 'ABCD,' has passed away at 53 due to a suspected cardiac arrest. He was found dead at his residence in Piravom after failing to wake up, and had been undergoing treatment for a heart ailment. Suresh, survived by his wife and two daughters, was a prominent figure in Kerala's mimicry scene for over three decades.
Pala Suresh Death News: Mimicry artist - actor Suresh Krishnan aka Pala Suresh found dead-- acted in Dulquer Salmaan's 'ABCD'; read more | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilmalayalamtelugukannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmentmalayalammoviesMimicry artist - actor Suresh Krishnan aka Pala Suresh found dead-- acted in Dulquer Salmaan's 'ABCD'; read moreTrendingAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaAR MurugadossAmeesha PatelFaissal KhanJaanArmaan MalikMandhira KapurAngelina JolieRajesh KhannaMithun ChakrabortyDarshan ThoogudeepaMimicry artist - actor Suresh Krishnan aka Pala Suresh found dead-- acted in Dulquer Salmaan's 'ABCD'; read moreEntertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 12:08 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMimicry artist and actor Pala Suresh, known for his impersonations of political figures and roles in films like 'ABCD,' has passed away at 53 due to a suspected cardiac arrest. He was found dead at his residence in Piravom after failing to wake up, and had been undergoing treatment for a heart ailment. Suresh, survived by his wife and two daughters, was a prominent figure in Kerala's mimicry scene for over three decades. (Picture Courtesy: Facebook) Mimicry artist and actor Suresh Krishnan, fondly known as Pala Suresh passed away at the age of 53.TRIGGER WARNING: This article contains mention of deathAs reported by Mathrubhumi News, Pala Suresh was found dead at his rented residence in Piravom on Sunday morning.Failed to wake up at usual time causing suspicionAccording to reports, Suresh had been undergoing treatment for a heart-related ailment at Kottayam Medical College Hospital. On Sunday, when he failed to wake up at his usual time, his family grew concerned. After breaking open the door, they rushed him to Piravom Taluk Hospital, where doctors declared him dead. It is suspected that he suffered a cardiac arrest in his sleep.For over three decades, Pala Suresh was a household name on mimicry stages across Kerala. He rose to prominence through stage shows and television programs. Pala Suresh gained special recognition for his witty and precise impersonations of political figures, including former Chief Minister Oommen Chandy.His talent extended to films and television as well. One of his memorable film roles was in 'ABCD: American-Born Confused Desi' (2013). Pala Suresh played the role of a journalist alongside Dulquer Salmaan in the superhit film. 'ABCD' was directed by Martin Prakkat and was released in the year 2013. The movie also featured the actors Tovino Thomas, Lalu Alex, Vijayaraghavan and Kalpana in pivotal roles.Beyond cinema, he was a professional artist with the Kollam Narma troupe and had been actively associated with Cochin Rasika, continuing to charm audiences with his humor and versatility.Family and final ritesPala Suresh was the son of the late Balan and Omana of Vettathukunnel House, Vellilappilly, Ramapuram. He is survived by his wife Deepa, and two daughters—Devananda, who is pursuing nursing in Germany, and Devakrishna. His funeral will take place on Tuesday *August 19), at Kanittumala Cemetery in Piravom."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorEntertainment Deskमटा मनोरंजन डेस्क ही मराठी आणि हिंदी चित्रपट, ओटीटी, संगीत, मराठी टीव्ही कार्यक्रम, वेब सिरीज आणि सेलिब्रिटी बातम्यांवर केंद्रित एक उत्साही टीम आहे. चित्रपट समीक्षण, कलाकारांच्या मुलाखती, ट्रेलर विश्लेषण, गॉसिप्स आणि सोशल मीडिया ट्रेंड्सवरील विश्वासार्ह आणि मनोरंजक माहिती आम्ही सर्जनशील शैलीत वाचकांपर्यंत पोहोचवितो. माहिती आणि मनोरंजन यांचा समतोल राखणे हे आमचे वैशिष्ट्य आहे.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousTaarak Mehta’s Sunayana Fozdar’s top 10 ethnic lookstv'Coolie' actress Rachita Ram's most gorgeous Angelina Jolie set to leave America and move abroad
Angelina Jolie is planning to leave Los Angeles and live abroad full-time once her youngest children, Knox and Vivienne, turn 18. She feels that Los Angeles cannot offer her or her children the humanity she has found across the world. This move follows other celebrities relocating overseas, such as Jimmy Kimmel, Ellen DeGeneres, and Rosie O'Donnell.
Angelina Jolie becomes latest Hollywood star to leave America; actress set to move abroad after end of custody arrangement with Brad Pitt | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsAngelina Jolie becomes latest Hollywood star to leave America; actress set to move abroad after end of custody arrangement with Brad PittAngelina Jolie becomes latest Hollywood star to leave America; actress set to move abroad after end of custody arrangement with Brad PittTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 19, 2025, 09:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAngelina Jolie is planning to leave Los Angeles and live abroad full-time once her youngest children, Knox and Vivienne, turn 18. She feels that Los Angeles cannot offer her or her children the humanity she has found across the world. This move follows other celebrities relocating overseas, such as Jimmy Kimmel, Ellen DeGeneres, and Rosie O'Donnell.  Hollywood star Angelina Jolie is reportedly gearing up to leave the United States and relocate abroad once her youngest children turn 18.The actress, is said to be considering “several locations abroad” as she prepares to list her Los Angeles home on the market, states a report on People. Jolie purchased the historic Cecil B. DeMille estate in Los Feliz in 2017 for a reported $24.5 million. The 11,000-square-foot property features six bedrooms and 10 bathrooms.Plan To Leave LAPeople reports that Jolie “never wanted to live in L.A. full time” but was limited by a custody arrangement with her former husband, Brad Pitt. Speaking to The Hollywood Reporter, Jolie admitted that she was living in LA only "because I have to be here from a divorce."Reason Why Jolie Was Forced To Stay In LAJolie said she’s ready to live abroad full time as she seeks qualities that Los Angeles can’t offer her or her children. "That humanity that I found across the world is not what I grew up with here," she said at the time.Pitt and Jolie, who finalised their divorce settlement in December, share six children. Jolie reportedly intends to relocate once the youngest twins, Knox and Vivienne, turn 18 next year.Hollywood Stars Moving AbroadJolie’s potential move abroad comes amid a wave of US celebrities relocating overseas following US President Donald Trump’s return to office. Talk show host Jimmy Kimmel recently revealed he had obtained Italian citizenship, while Ellen DeGeneres and her wife, Portia de Rossi, moved to England’s Cotswolds in late 2024. Comedian Rosie O’Donnell also confirmed earlier this year that she had relocated to Ireland. Richard Geere also announced his decision to move to Spain. On the work front Jolie will reunite with Mr & Mrs Smith director Doug Liman on an upcoming spy thriller, The Initiative."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Pallavi SLAMS govt for stopping The Bengal Files trailer launch
Pallavi Joshi has strongly criticised the West Bengal administration after authorities allegedly halted the trailer launch of ‘The Bengal Files’ in Kolkata. Joshi deemed the government's actions as unconstitutional and an attack on democracy. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, explores the 1946 Great Calcutta killings and stars Anupam Kher and Mithun Chakraborty.
Pallavi Joshi SLAMS West Bengal government for stopping ‘The Bengal Files’ trailer launch in Kolkata; calls it an ‘assault on democracy’ | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodPallavi Joshi SLAMS West Bengal government for stopping ‘The Bengal Files’ trailer launch in Kolkata; calls it an ‘assault on democracy’TrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleasePallavi Joshi SLAMS West Bengal government for stopping ‘The Bengal Files’ trailer launch in Kolkata; calls it an ‘assault on democracy’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:47 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePallavi Joshi has strongly criticised the West Bengal administration after authorities allegedly halted the trailer launch of ‘The Bengal Files’ in Kolkata. Joshi deemed the government's actions as unconstitutional and an attack on democracy. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, explores the 1946 Great Calcutta killings and stars Anupam Kher and Mithun Chakraborty.  Actress Pallavi Joshi has criticised the West Bengal administration after the trailer launch of ‘The Bengal Files’ was allegedly stopped in Kolkata last week. Joshi, who stars in the movie, called the government’s actions “unconstitutional” and dubbed the halt an 'attack on democracy'.On August 16, 2025, the film's director, Vivek Agnihotri claimed that the trailer launch was stopped at a five-star hotel in Kolkata. NDTV later reported that Kolkata Police said the director had not sought administrative permission for a public trailer viewing. Videos of police entering the venue quickly went viral on social media.Anupam Kher Praises Pallavi Joshi; Actress Stuns In ‘Tanvi The Great’ First LookPallavi reactsAs reported by India Today, Pallavi spoke at the trailer launch in New Delhi on Monday and said, "Since the story is rooted in Bengal, we felt it would be most appropriate to launch the trailer in Bengal in August, but the government silenced us. We feel it is an act which is not only arbitrary but also unconstitutional."She added, "What happened that day was not merely an assault on the film, but an assault on democracy itself. The voices of people and the voice of Bharat were suppressed and censored. The absence of dignity and the absence of the value of human life are the themes of our film. The government proved our theme is correct."Trailer launch halted on “laughable grounds”Joshi also expressed frustration at the reason given for stopping the event, was on "very laughable grounds." She went on to add, "They said we didn't have municipal permission...The videos are about the chaos that followed. Many women journalists got hurt. I was also very uncomfortable. Thanks to Vivek, we managed to get out. We feel the police and the government are forgetting their basic duty, i.e, protecting its citizens, especially women, and their modesty. That should have been the sole priority of women."About ‘The Bengal Files’‘The Bengal Files’ is based on the 1946 Great Calcutta killings, a tragic historical episode during the final years of British colonial rule. The film stars Anupam Kher, Mithun Chakraborty, Saswata Chatterjee, and Pallavi Joshi. Directed by Vivek Agnihotri, the film is set to release on September 5, 2025."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Vishal gets nostalgic as Priyanka and Shahid 'Kaminey' clocks 16th years
Priyanka Chopra celebrated the 16th anniversary of 'Kaminey' with an emotional Instagram post, sparking a nostalgic reaction from director Vishal Bhardwaj. Chopra reminisced about landing the role of Sweety Bhope and her admiration for Bhardwaj. The director responded with a heartfelt note, recalling cherished memories and a handwritten poem for Chopra.
Vishal Bhardwaj gets nostalgic as Priyanka Chopra and Shahid Kapoor's 'Kaminey' clocks 16th years: 'Ask me how much I miss those days' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodVishal Bhardwaj gets nostalgic as Priyanka Chopra and Shahid Kapoor's 'Kaminey' clocks 16th years: 'Ask me how much I miss those days'TrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseVishal Bhardwaj gets nostalgic as Priyanka Chopra and Shahid Kapoor's 'Kaminey' clocks 16th years: 'Ask me how much I miss those days'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:46 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePriyanka Chopra celebrated the 16th anniversary of 'Kaminey' with an emotional Instagram post, sparking a nostalgic reaction from director Vishal Bhardwaj. Chopra reminisced about landing the role of Sweety Bhope and her admiration for Bhardwaj. The director responded with a heartfelt note, recalling cherished memories and a handwritten poem for Chopra.  Actor Priyanka Chopra marked the 16th anniversary of the release of her film 'Kaminey' by sharing an emotional Instagram post. Soon after she shared the heartfelt post, the film’s director, Vishal Bhardwaj penned a sweet reaction that quickly went viral, and stired nostalgia among fans.Priyanka recalls her 'Kaminey' journeyIn her post, Priyanka shared clips from Kaminey, where she played Sweety Bhope opposite Shahid Kapoor’s Guddu. Recounting how she landed the role, Priyanka wrote, “I remember him telling me the story and I said, ‘Well, she has approximately 8 scenes.’ And he said, ‘With us working on it, it will end up being so much more. Trust me.’ And I did.”She added that Bhardwaj had promised to create something even more remarkable for her, which later turned out to be 7 Khoon Maaf. “But honestly, I was just greedy to work with him,” she admitted, showcasing her deep admiration for the filmmaker.Disha Patani’s Surprise Cameo in Vishal Bhardwaj’s Next | Dance Numbers With Shahid KapoorVishal Bhardwaj’s heartfelt responseThe director reshared her tribute with a moving note, expressing how much he cherished those days of collaboration. “Ask me how much I miss those days. You have been one of the finest collaborations of my career,” he wrote.Bhardwaj also shared a personal memory of a day when Priyanka was upset on set, “Remember one day, when you got angry, I handwrote a poem on a napkin and sent it to manaoo you. ‘Doosri jangaleedam ko khatam huye bhi beetein saal. Ab bhi kuch Japani afsar chhupien mile hain duty par. Tum se kab ab milna hoga… Kya ab bhi naraaz ho tum?’”Priyanka penned a warm reply, “Hahaha aapse kaun naraaz reh sakta hai? Aaiye milne.”Fans root for another collaborationTheir heartfelt exchange had many urging Priyanka to return to Bollywood for more memorable roles. Meanwhile, Priyanka will be next seen in upcoming film with SS Rajamouli and Mahesh Babu (SSMB29).Priyanka Chopra’s no-makeup look at Hyderabad airport leaves fans shocked"Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Watch: Fahadh Faasil brings back 'Aavesham' dance moves
Malayalam superstar Fahadh Faasil delighted fans at a college event in Ernakulam. He recreated his famous dance moves from the blockbuster movie Aavesham. This happened during the promotion of his upcoming film, Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira. The crowd went wild as he performed the viral steps. His co-stars Kalyani Priyadarshan and others joined him on stage. The trailer of Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira shows Fahadh in a romantic role.
Watch: Fahadh Faasil brings back 'Aavesham' dance moves; fans go wild | Malayalam Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilmalayalamtelugukannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmentmalayalammoviesWatch: Fahadh Faasil brings back 'Aavesham' dance moves; fans go wildTrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseWatch: Fahadh Faasil brings back 'Aavesham' dance moves; fans go wildEntertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 10:03 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMalayalam superstar Fahadh Faasil delighted fans at a college event in Ernakulam. He recreated his famous dance moves from the blockbuster movie Aavesham. This happened during the promotion of his upcoming film, Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira. The crowd went wild as he performed the viral steps. His co-stars Kalyani Priyadarshan and others joined him on stage. The trailer of Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira shows Fahadh in a romantic role.  (Picture Courtesy: Facebook) Malayalam superstar Fahadh Faasil surprised fans with a nostalgic moment during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira' (OKCK). At a college event in Ernakulam, the actor recreated his now-iconic dance steps from last year’s blockbuster Aavesham, sending the crowd into a frenzy.A viral dance that lives onThe event saw Fahadh join his co-stars Kalyani Priyadarshan, Revathi Pillai, Vinay Forrt, and director Althaf Salim on stage.Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira - Official TrailerWhen the beats of 'Aavesham’s chartbuster 'Odimaga' started playing, fans cheered as Fahadh slipped back into his viral moves, proving yet again why the performance had become such a cultural sensation.The students were seen chanting the 'Pushpa' actor's name and capturing the moment on their phones. Interestingly, Fahadh Faasil is also seen calling Kalyani Priyadarshan and others to join the dance.The video is going viral on social media for all the righ reasons. One Tweet read, "Rangan Chetta Neegala (Is this you Rangan chettan?)." Another one commented, "Fahadh Faasil dance is fire."PollAre you excited about the Onam release of 'Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira'?Absolutely!Not really.Check out the video here.Promotions filled with fun and energyThe promotional event wasn’t just about dance. Fahadh and the team interacted with the students, sharing anecdotes from the shoot of'Odum kuthira Chadum Kuthira'The recently released trailer of OKCK offers a glimpse of Fahadh in a romantic role and the story unfolds around a wedding, with his character Aby caught between Kalyani Priyadarshan and Revathi Pillai’s characters. Vinay Forrt’s presence adds a comic flavor, while director Althaf Salim promises a blend of emotions wrapped in lighthearted fun.Onam release around the corner'Odum Kuthira Chaadum Kuthira' is set for a festive release on August 29, coinciding with Onam celebrations. The music is composed by Justin Varghese and has vibrant visuals shot across Kerala, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu. On the other hand, Fahadh Faasil will be next seen iun Mahesh Narayanan's multistarrer film 'Patriot'."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About कलाकारांच्या मुलाखती, ट्रेलर विश्लेषण, गॉसिप्स आणि सोशल मीडिया ट्रेंड्सवरील विश्वासार्ह आणि मनोरंजक माहिती आम्ही सर्जनशील शैलीत वाचकांपर्यंत पोहोचवितो. माहिती आणि मनोरंजन यांचा समतोल राखणे हे आमचे Rashmika and Vijay to announce relationship soon?
Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda ignited relationship speculations once again during their appearance at a New York City event. The rumored couple, who attended the India Day Parade and a Bharat Beyond Borders discussion, displayed undeniable chemistry, sparking fan excitement.
Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's crackling chemistry at New York event goes VIRAL; fans ask 'Will they announce their relationship soon?' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's crackling chemistry at New York event goes VIRAL; fans ask 'Will they announce their relationship soon?'TrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's crackling chemistry at New York event goes VIRAL; fans ask 'Will they announce their relationship soon?'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 08:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda ignited relationship speculations once again during their appearance at a New York City event. The rumored couple, who attended the India Day Parade and a Bharat Beyond Borders discussion, displayed undeniable chemistry, sparking fan excitement.  Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have once again set the internet abuzz, this time with their undeniable chemistry during an event they attended in New York City. Viral VideoThe rumoured couple, who have been linked for years but have never officially confirmed a relationship, headed to NYC to attend the India Day Parade. The two, twitched up their outfits before heading to attend the Bharat Beyond Borders discussion.Rashmika Mandanna Celebrates 6 Years Of ‘Dear Comrade’ With Vijay DeverakondaCrackling ChemistryA video from the event that turned up online, saw the two all smiles as they chatted with the audience. Fans were quick to point out their relaxed camaraderie and their crackling chemistry as they took questions from the audience. Vijay was also seen leaning towards his rumoured lady love while posing for photos, adding fuel to long-running rumours about their relationship status.Fans ReactThe sighting has sparked a flurry of speculation online, with fans wondering if the two stars are finally ready to make their relationship official. “Is this the sign that they are going to announce their relationship soon...” one user asked, while another wrote, “Stop teasing us and just announce it already!”Dating BuzzRashmika and Vijay, have reportedly been dating under the radar. Although they have yet to post photos together, fans have noted that the two have been sharing photos from similar locations, thus arriving at the conclusion that the two have been travelling the globe, holidaying together. Neither actor has responded to the wave of speculation around their love life, keeping their personal lives guarded as always. For now, fans continue to play detective, trying to spot the similarities in their posts and read between the lines.
