THIS actor was thrown out of film even after National Award
Mithun Chakraborty, faced early career hurdles due to his skin color and financial struggles, even sleeping on footpaths. Despite winning a National Award early on, he battled prejudice and professional setbacks. Zeenat Aman's support proved pivotal, leading to his rise as a superstar with films like 'Disco Dancer,' ultimately earning him the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.
Meet the actor who slept on the footpath, got thrown out of film even after National Award win, was helped by Zeenat Aman and went on to work in over 350 films | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodMeet the actor who slept on the footpath, got thrown out of film even after National Award win, was helped by Zeenat Aman and went on to work in over 350 filmsTrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseMeet the actor who slept on the footpath, got thrown out of film even after National Award win, was helped by Zeenat Aman and went on to work in over 350 filmsTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 08:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMithun Chakraborty, faced early career hurdles due to his skin color and financial struggles, even sleeping on footpaths. Despite winning a National Award early on, he battled prejudice and professional setbacks. Zeenat Aman's support proved pivotal, leading to his rise as a superstar with films like 'Disco Dancer,' ultimately earning him the Dadasaheb Phalke Award.  Mithun Chakraborty, the star who danced his way into history with iconic hits like ‘Disco Dancer’, ‘Dance Dance’, ‘Pyar Jhukta Nahin’, ‘Kasam Paida Karne Wale Ki’ and ‘Commando’, has lived one of the most dramatic journeys in Bollywood. From being shamed for his skin colour and thrown out of films even after winning a National Award, to sleeping on footpaths during his struggling days, his rise was anything but easy.'Ek Ke Baad Ek BrahMos, Then A Pee Dam': Mithun Chakraborty Warns Pak, Takes Dig At Bilawal BhuttoMithun’s early daysMithun was born on 16 July 1950, as Gouranga Chakraborty. He studied at Kolkata’s Scottish Church College. Coming from a lower middle-class family, he faced financial struggles right from the start. Later, he cracked admission into the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII), one of the country’s most prestigious film schools, where he trained to be a professional actor.Sleeping on footpaths to surviveHis road to films was far from easy. Before his debut, Mithun went through years of hardship in Mumbai. He often slept hungry and even spent nights on footpaths. Recalling those dark days on the reality show Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Li’l Champs, Mithun had said, “I have seen days when I had to sleep with an empty stomach, and I used to cry myself to sleep. In fact, there were days when I had to think about what my next meal will be, and where I will go to sleep. I have also slept on the footpath for a lot of days.”Why Mithun does not want a biopicDespite his success, Mithun never wants his life to be made into a film. He explained, “And that’s the only reason I don’t want my biopic to be ever made! My story will never inspire anyone, it will break them down (mentally) and discourage people from achieving their dreams. I don’t want that to happen! If I can do it, anyone else can do it. I have fought a lot to prove myself in this industry. I am not legendary because I have given hit movies, I am a legend because I have surpassed all the pains and struggles of my life.”Winning a National Award but losing workMithun made his big screen debut with Mrinal Sen’s ‘Mrigayaa’. The film not only marked his entry into Bollywood but also won him the National Award for Best Actor. While most actors wait years for such recognition, Mithun achieved it with his first film. But instead of helping his career, the award created unexpected problems.He recalled in an interview with India Today, “After Mrigayaa, I got my first National Award. As it happens, I started acting like Al Pacino. It felt like I was the greatest actor. My attitude changed, so the producer saw this and said, ‘get out.’ Then I realised my mistake.”Shamed for skin colour in BollywoodIf pride slowed him down, prejudice nearly broke him. Mithun was constantly reminded of his complexion. In an interview with Radio Nasha, he shared, “I was always called out for my skin colour. I have been disrespected for a lot of years because of my skin colour.”He used dance as a way to shift the focus, “I thought that if I danced with my legs, nobody would see my colour and that happened. My dance made people forget my colour. Nobody imagined a hero with my colour. I used to feel very bad and I used to cry.”Becoming the common man’s superstarFor millions of fans, Mithun became proof that even someone with nothing could make it big. He said,“Looking at me, people’s expectations increased and they thought that even my son can become an actor despite living in a chawl or village. I became a common man’s hero. It was a very big thing for me to become a superstar of a common man.”Zeenat Aman breaks the industry jinxJust when he was being pushed aside, help came from one of Bollywood’s leading ladies. Zeenat Aman, who was at the peak of her career, agreed to star opposite him in Brij Sadanah’s ‘Taqdeer’. It proved to be a turning point.As Mithun shared on Sa Re Ga Ma Pa, “It was Zeenat ji who broke the jinx. Zeenat ji had the status of the number 1 heroine of that time, so following her footsteps, every other actress started saying yes to the films that I worked in. With Taqdeer’s release, I became an A-category actor.”From ‘Surakshaa’ to ‘Disco Dancer’ fameThree years after ‘Mrigayaa’, Mithun hit another milestone with the 1979 spy thriller ‘Surakshaa’. This film laid the foundation for his superstardom in the ’80s. The success was followed by blockbusters like ‘Disco Dancer’, ‘Dance Dance’, ‘Pyar Jhukta Nahin’, ‘Kasam Paida Karne Wale Ki’, and many more’. His unique moves and on-screen charm made him the king of dance films and one of the biggest stars of that decade.Beyond commercial hits, Mithun proved himself as a serious actor too. As reported by IMDb, he went on to star in over 350 films across multiple languages. He went on to win two more National Awards for ‘Tahader Katha’ in 1992 and ‘Swami Vivekananda’ in 1998. Decades later, his contribution to Indian cinema was celebrated once again when he was honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 70th National Film Awards in 2024."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousPreity Mukhundhan radiates Kim Jong Kook announces marriage plans! - Details Inside
Korean singer Kim Jong Kook revealed his marriage plans on 'Running Man'. The announcement surprised cast members and fans. He shared the news on a fan forum, seeking support. Kim Jong Kook mentioned it's his 30th debut anniversary. Instead of an album, he found a partner. Speculation surrounds his future wife's identity.
K-Pop star Kim Jong Kook announces marriage plans! Fans speculate about lucky lady set to wed the idol | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNewsK-Pop star Kim Jong Kook announces marriage plans! Fans speculate about lucky lady set to wed the idolK-Pop star Kim Jong Kook announces marriage plans! Fans speculate about lucky lady set to wed the idolTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 19, 2025, 08:04 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKorean singer Kim Jong Kook revealed his marriage plans on 'Running Man'. The announcement surprised cast members and fans. He shared the news on a fan forum, seeking support. Kim Jong Kook mentioned it's his 30th debut anniversary. Instead of an album, he found a partner. Speculation surrounds his future wife's identity.  Kim Jong Kook, a renowned Korean singer who is also known for his variety skills, is officially tying the knot!In a recent episode of a variety show, the star made the big revelation, shocking everyone on set. The news comes as a surprise to many as the hunk has managed to keep his love life rather private.Kim Jong Kook announces marriageIn a recent episode of a popular Korean variety show titled 'Running Man,' Jong Kook made the shocking revelation on August 18, which the cast members first thought was a part of a prank segment. The singer shared that he will soon be tying the knot and getting married, which managed to surprise everyone.Along with the regular cast members, Jong Kook was also joined by renowned actors Jang Dong Yoon and Kim Ah Young for that day's segment, which was being filmed in Pyeongtaek, Gyeonggi Province.As per Allkpop, he also shared the news with his fans and netizens through a post on a popular fan forum.He shared a heartfelt message that read, “I always thought the day would come when I’d have to write something like this, and I had prepared myself for it. But now that I’m actually writing, I’m more nervous and anxious than I ever imagined. I’m getting married."He also talked about how even though it may be a little late for him, it is still something that he is looking forward to, and also asked his fans for their support and love in this next chapter of his life. He also jokes about how, instead of sharing a new album for his 30th anniversary, he ended up getting a partner instead.The post read, "I know I’ve dropped little hints here and there, but I’m sure it still feels sudden to many of you. This year marks my 30th debut anniversary, and instead of making the album I wanted, I’ve created my other half. Please congratulate and support me."Who is the mysterious woman? While Jong Kook shared that he is about to tie the knot, he did not provide many details about who his soon-to-be wife is. Netizens and fans, since the announcement, have been trying to piece together clues that could clarify who she may be.Recently, Sports Chosun shared a report about who she may be. In the report, it was mentioned that the idol may be getting married to a Korean American businesswoman from Los Angeles.Rumours of him dating an American woman have been going on since 2018, and while nothing has been confirmed by the idol himself, fans have been wondering about whether the rumours were true after all or not."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousPreity Mukhundhan radiates When Big B teased Anushka over Virat’s flying kisses
Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's adorable on-field moments, like Virat's flying kisses, once became a source of amusement on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati.' Amitabh Bachchan playfully teased Anushka about it during her appearance with Varun Dhawan to promote 'Sui Dhaaga.' The couple, married since 2017 and parents to Vamika and Akaay, were recently spotted enjoying family time in London.
When Amitabh Bachchan teased Anushka Sharma over Virat Kohli’s flying kisses on cricket grounds: Here’s how she reacted | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWhen Amitabh Bachchan teased Anushka Sharma over Virat Kohli’s flying kisses on cricket grounds: Here’s how she reactedTrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseWhen Amitabh Bachchan teased Anushka Sharma over Virat Kohli’s flying kisses on cricket grounds: Here’s how she reactedTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:02 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAnushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's adorable on-field moments, like Virat's flying kisses, once became a source of amusement on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati.' Amitabh Bachchan playfully teased Anushka about it during her appearance with Varun Dhawan to promote 'Sui Dhaaga.' The couple, married since 2017 and parents to Vamika and Akaay, were recently spotted enjoying family time in London.  Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli are one of the most loved celebrity couples in India. Though they kept their relationship quiet in the beginning, once they tied the knot, they never shied away from showing affection for each other in public. One of the most adorable moments between them happens on the cricket ground. Every time Virat scores a century, he blows a flying kiss towards Anushka in the stands.But did you know that this sweet tradition once became the subject of a light-hearted tease on television? It happened on none other than ‘Kaun Banega Crorepati’, where Amitabh Bachchan himself pulled Anushka’s leg in front of a live audience.When Anushka came to ‘KBC’A few years ago, Anushka had joined Big B’s popular quiz show ‘Kaun Banega Crorepati’ to promote her film ‘Sui Dhaaga’ along with Varun Dhawan. While there, she also sat beside a participant on the hot seat. That was when the fun began.The ‘Zanjeer’ actor casually asked the contestant if she watches cricket on television. She replied that she does not. Amitabh then pointed out with a smile that Anushka certainly does.Anushka explained why she watches cricketThe contestant looked a little puzzled by his remark. To clear the confusion, Anushka jumped in and said that her husband is a cricketer and that she watches cricket for him. That is when Amitabh decided to tease her. He asked cheekily, “Kewal unko dekhne ke kiye (Just for him)?” The ‘Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi’ actress quickly corrected herself, adding that she also watches to support the team.Amitabh mimicked Virat’s flying kissNot letting the fun stop there, the ‘Sholay’ actor went on to tease her further. He said everyone knows what happens on television and then, to the surprise of all, blew a kiss to the camera. The gesture was a clear imitation of Virat’s famous flying kiss celebration on the field.The moment had everyone in splits. Anushka burst out laughing, the audience clapped and laughed, and Varun Dhawan could not control himself either. He was seen rolling with laughter as Amitabh pulled off the playful act perfectly.Virat and Anushka’s wedding and childrenAnushka and Virat took their relationship to the next step when they tied the knot in a dreamy ceremony in December 2017. The much-talked-about wedding was followed by more happy news. The couple was blessed with their daughter Vamika in January 2021, and later, they welcomed their son Akaay in February 2024. Their life as parents has been filled with love and joy, and they have always tried to keep their children away from the media glare.Couple enjoys family time in LondonCurrently, Anushka and Virat are in London, where they are spending some private family time together. Videos recently surfaced on social media, showing the couple enjoying a sunny day out. Interestingly, they were spotted without their children Vamika and Akaay during this outing. In the clip, the two could be seen going about their day casually, interacting warmly with local residents and enjoying a relaxed moment away from their otherwise busy lives."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Rajinikanth's Coolie crosses Rs 200 crore mark on Day 5
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' has stormed into the Rs 200 crore club within five days, fueled by a massive opening and Independence Day fervor. Despite a Monday dip, strong night show attendance, particularly in Tamil Nadu, propelled the film past the milestone. Its pan-Indian appeal is evident, with significant contributions from Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi versions.
Coolie Box Office Collection Day 5: Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 200 crore mark; sees dip in collections on first Monday | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardsNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesbox-officeCoolie Box Office Collection Day 5: Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 200 crore mark; sees dip in collections on first MondayTrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseCoolie Box Office Collection Day 5: Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 200 crore mark; sees dip in collections on first MondayTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:58 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie' has stormed into the Rs 200 crore club within five days, fueled by a massive opening and Independence Day fervor. Despite a Monday dip, strong night show attendance, particularly in Tamil Nadu, propelled the film past the milestone. Its pan-Indian appeal is evident, with significant contributions from Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi versions.  Rajinikanth’s latest release 'Coolie' has officially entered the Rs 200 crore club within just five days of release. The mass entertainer, which opened to a thunderous response on August 14, saw its first major dip on Monday but still managed to post impressive numbers.Coolie Movie Review Strong start and extended weekend runCoolie began its box office journey with a massive Rs 65 crore debut, riding on Rajinikanth’s star power and Independence Day fervour. The film’s collections peaked on the national holiday with Rs 54.75 crore net. However, Saturday and Sunday saw a gradual slowdown, with the film collecting Rs 39.5 crore and Rs 35.25 crore respectively. By the end of its first extended weekend, the film had already amassed an estimated Rs 194.50 crore net in India.Day 5 – Monday dropOn its first Monday, 'Coolie' earned around Rs 12 crore net across all languages (early estimates). Despite the decline, strong footfalls during the night shows especially in Tamil Nadu helped the film push its overall India net total to an estimated Rs 206.50 crore.PollHow do you think 'Coolie' will perform in the coming weeks?It will continue to do wellIt will decline sharplyRegional breakdownThe film’s dominance is spread across markets, with the Tamil version leading the way at Rs 128.05 crore, followed by the Telugu dubbed version contributing Rs 45.1 crore, and the Hindi version adding Rs 19.75 crore. This strong performance across languages has firmly established 'Coolie' as one of the most successful pan-India releases of the year.Rajinikanth’s box office streakWith this film, Rajinikanth has now delivered his fourth consecutive Rs 100 crore grosser. The film also joins his elite Rs 200 crore club alongside Vettaiyan, which crossed Rs 250 crore in 2024. Meanwhile Jailer and 2.0 remain his highest-grossing films to date, each surpassing the Rs 600 crore mark.Though Coolie has shown a Monday dip, industry trackers believe it will continue to dominate the box office over the coming week, especially in the South, and could emerge as one of the highest earners of 2025.'Coolie' box office collections day 6 (live): Rajinikanth’s actioner maintains strong pace; crosses Rs 206.65 crores"Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Matthew Perry death: 'Ketamine Queen' to plead guilty
A dealer dubbed the "Ketamine Queen" has agreed to plead guilty to supplying the drugs that killed "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, the US Department of Justice said Monday. Iwamasa repeatedly injected Perry with the ketamine that Sangha supplied, including on October 28, 2023, when he administered at least three shots of Sangha's ketamine, which killed the actor.
Matthew Perry death: 'Ketamine Queen' Jasveen Sangha to plead guilty for supplying drugs | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmentenglishhollywoodMatthew Perry death: 'Ketamine Queen' Jasveen Sangha to plead guilty for supplying drugsTrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseMatthew Perry death: 'Ketamine Queen' Jasveen Sangha to plead guilty for supplying drugsAFP / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 06:09 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeA dealer dubbed the "Ketamine Queen" has agreed to plead guilty to supplying the drugs that killed "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, the US Department of Justice said Monday. Iwamasa repeatedly injected Perry with the ketamine that Sangha supplied, including on October 28, 2023, when he administered at least three shots of Sangha's ketamine, which killed the actor.  Jasveen Sangha, a dealer dubbed the "Ketamine Queen" has agreed to plead guilty to supplying the drugs that killed "Friends" actor Matthew Perry, the US Department of Justice said Monday.Sangha, 42, will admit several charges, including one of distribution of ketamine resulting in death or serious bodily injury in relation to the late star.A dual citizen of the United States and Britain, she is expected to formally enter her pleas in the coming weeks. She has been in federal custody since August 2024.Sangha will become the fifth person to admit playing a part in the death of the beloved actor, who had openly struggled for decades with substance addiction.Perry, 54, was found dead in the hot tub of his Los Angeles home in October 2023.A criminal investigation was launched soon after an autopsy discovered he had high levels of ketamine -- an anesthetic -- in his system.Last month, Dr Salvador Plasencia pleaded guilty to four counts of distribution of ketamine in the weeks before Perry's death.Another doctor, Mark Chavez, admitted last year to conspiring to distribute ketamine to Perry.Plasencia allegedly bought ketamine off Chavez and sold it to the American-Canadian actor at hugely inflated prices."I wonder how much this moron will pay," Plasencia wrote in one text message.According to her plea agreement, Sangha worked with a middleman, Erik Fleming, to sell 51 vials of ketamine to Perry's live-in personal assistant, Kenneth Iwamasa.Iwamasa repeatedly injected Perry with the ketamine that Sangha supplied, including on October 28, 2023, when he administered at least three shots of Sangha's ketamine, which killed the actor.The Justice Department said when Sangha heard news reports about Perry's sudden death, she tried to cover her tracks."Delete all our messages," she instructed Fleming.When investigators raided Sangha's home they found methamphetamine, ketamine, ecstasy, cocaine, and counterfeit Xanax pills, as well as a money counting machine, a scale, and devices to detect wireless signals and hidden cameras, according to the Justice Department.- 'Mostly sober' -Sangha is expected to plead guilty to one count of maintaining a drug-involved premises, three counts of distribution of ketamine, and one count of distribution of ketamine resulting in death or serious bodily injury."She's taking responsibility for her actions," her lawyer Mark Geragos told AFP.Sangha could face decades in prison when sentenced.The other people involved in the supply of drugs to Perry are expected to appear in court over the coming months to learn their fates.Perry had been taking ketamine as part of supervised therapy for depression.But prosecutors say that before his death he became addicted to the substance, which also has psychedelic properties and is a popular party drug."Friends," which followed the lives of six New Yorkers navigating adulthood, dating and careers, drew a massive following and made megastars of previously unknown actors.Perry's role as the sarcastic man-child Chandler brought him fabulous wealth, but hid a dark struggle with addiction to painkillers and alcohol.In 2018, he suffered a drug-related burst colon and underwent multiple surgeries.In his 2022 memoir "Friends, Lovers and the Big Terrible Thing," Perry described going through detox dozens of times."I have mostly been sober since 2001," he wrote, "save for about sixty or seventy little mishaps.""Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousPreity Mukhundhan radiates Rajinikanth’s fitness mantra at 74
Rajinikanth, the Indian cinema icon, is proving that age is just a number. A viral gym video showcases his dedication to fitness through disciplined workouts. Beyond physical exercise, he emphasizes yoga, meditation, and a clean vegetarian diet for overall well-being. His latest film, ‘Coolie,’ released on August 14th, has already grossed over Rs.
Rajinikanth’s fitness mantra: How the ‘Coolie’ star balances workouts, yoga and a clean lifestyle to stay strong and rule the Box Office at 74 | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesRajinikanth’s fitness mantra: How the ‘Coolie’ star balances workouts, yoga and a clean lifestyle to stay strong and rule the Box Office at 74TrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseRajinikanth’s fitness mantra: How the ‘Coolie’ star balances workouts, yoga and a clean lifestyle to stay strong and rule the Box Office at 74TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 10:37 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth, the Indian cinema icon, is proving that age is just a number. A viral gym video showcases his dedication to fitness through disciplined workouts. Beyond physical exercise, he emphasizes yoga, meditation, and a clean vegetarian diet for overall well-being. His latest film, ‘Coolie,’ released on August 14th, has already grossed over Rs.  Rajinikanth, often called one of the greatest icons of Indian cinema, has ruled the silver screen for nearly fifty years. With a career packed with blockbuster hits and an unmatched fan base, his charm and energy continue to inspire people across the world. Even at seventy-four, the superstar of ‘Coolie’ and ‘Jailer’ shows no signs of slowing down. Instead, he is proving every day that age is no barrier to fitness, health and success.Viral gym videoRecently, a short clip of Rajinikanth exercising in a gym went viral on social media. Fans were thrilled to see the actor working out with the same discipline that made him a star. In the video, he begins with an incline dumbbell press, building strength in his upper body. He then moves to squats with the help of a bench, targeting his legs and core. To finish, he flexes his biceps while his trainer stands proudly beside him. The video was shared widely, with fans praising his determination and showing how fitness is a lifelong commitment.The power of Yoga, Meditation and KriyaWhile gym workouts are important, Rajinikanth also gives equal importance to inner strength. Yoga and breathing exercises have been part of his daily routine for years, reported The Health Site. In an interview cited by Telugu movie entertainment website Cinejosh, he has often credited more than 20 years of Kriya Yoga practice for giving him energy, focus and inner calm. This discipline, he believes, is the real reason behind his ability to remain positive and balanced even with the pressures of stardom.A simple and clean vegetarian dietRajinikanth made a big change in his lifestyle in 2014 when he adopted vegetarianism for health reasons. Since then, his meals are fresh, simple and home-cooked. As reported by Business Standard, he prefers fruits, vegetables, grains and nuts, while cutting out processed foods, sugar, fast food and refined dairy products. This clean diet not only keeps his body fit but also gives him the energy he needs to perform with such vigour on screen.Rest, recovery and time in natureAnother secret to his energy is proper rest and recovery. Sleep is non-negotiable for Rajinikanth. After completing each film, he takes time off to recharge and visits the Himalayas, where he finds both peace and strength in the lap of nature. These trips are not just about physical rest but also about spiritual healing, which helps him return to work with renewed energy.Discipline over quick fixesUnlike many who look for shortcuts, Rajinikanth’s fitness is built on years of discipline. He combines structured workouts, meditation, clean eating and rest in a way that balances both body and mind. His lifestyle shows that real strength comes from consistency, mindfulness and a deep spiritual connection. This is why he remains a wellness icon for fans across all age groups.‘Coolie’ roars at the Box OfficeEven as he maintains his health, Rajinikanth continues to deliver massive hits. His latest film ‘Coolie’, released on 14 August, turned theatres into a festival. The film created huge excitement from the start and lived up to expectations with a strong opening. Despite clashing with the big Bollywood spy thriller ‘War 2’, starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani, ‘Coolie’ stormed ahead from day one. According to Sacnilk, the film collected over Rs. 206 crores in just five days, proving once again that Rajinikanth’s magic at the box office is as powerful as ever."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. ​Boney shares rare 'Mr India throwback' pictures
Boney Kapoor shared nostalgic, unseen pictures from the sets of his 1987 blockbuster, 'Mr. India,' featuring Shekhar Kapur, Jeetendra, and Shashi Kapoor. The photos capture behind-the-scenes moments, with Shashi and Jeetendra impressed by the crew's passion. Boney revealed the film's special effects were done live, praising the dedication.
​Boney Kapoor shares rare 'Mr India throwback' pictures; fans get nostalgic as Janhvi Kapoor says, ‘Looking good, Papa’ | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood​Boney Kapoor shares rare 'Mr India throwback' pictures; fans get nostalgic as Janhvi Kapoor says, ‘Looking good, Papa’TrendingAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott ReleaseAR MurugadossFaissal KhanJaanMandhira KapurMonalisaSunjay KapurArmaan MalikRajesh KhannaDarshan ThoogudeepaMission Impossible Ott Release​Boney Kapoor shares rare 'Mr India throwback' pictures; fans get nostalgic as Janhvi Kapoor says, ‘Looking good, Papa’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 09:01 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeBoney Kapoor shared nostalgic, unseen pictures from the sets of his 1987 blockbuster, 'Mr. India,' featuring Shekhar Kapur, Jeetendra, and Shashi Kapoor. The photos capture behind-the-scenes moments, with Shashi and Jeetendra impressed by the crew's passion. Boney revealed the film's special effects were done live, praising the dedication.  Boney Kapoor took fans on a nostalgic ride by sharing throwback pictures from the sets of his 1987 blockbuster Mr India. The unseen moments brought back memories of the golden era of cinema.A candid moment on setOne of the throwback pictures captures filmmaker Shekhar Kapur deep in conversation with actor Jeetendra, while a young Boney Kapoor can be spotted standing in the background, watching the exchange.Boney Kapoor rocks 22-year-old jeans and 18-year-old shirt—Janhvi replies, 'Wow papa'The other photo shows Boney seated and engaged in a discussion with veteran actor and director Shashi Kapoor, offering a rare glimpse into the behind-the-scenes moments of the film industry.In his caption, Boney shared that Shashi and Jeetendra had dropped by the sets just to 'witness the madness,' but ended up leaving truly impressed by what they saw. He shared the photos with the caption, "Some esteemed guests who came to witness the madness of the crew on the sets of Mr India but went back appreciating the passion of every crew member. The film was shot for over 300 days & all the special effects were done live in Camera nothing was left for post, as the existing special effects studios/setups were outdated & their outputs/jobs were quite tacky."Janhvi praises her dadWell, these throwback pictures grabbed a lot of attention and love from fans, his daughter, Janhvi Kapoor, also joined the cheer brigade. She dropped several heart emojis and wrote, “Looking good papa.”Fans too joined in the nostalgia, calling the men in the photos “handsome dudes,” with many showering them with love.About the film'Mr India', directed by Shekhar Kapur and produced by Boney Kapoor, starred Anil Kapoor in a leading role alongside Sridevi as the lead actress and Amrish Puri in a prominent role."Get the latest updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold.
